content: As I've graduating to my mid-40's my skin has stayed combination oily but now I struggle with adult acne along with wrinkles and some sun spots. It's a watery consistency with no scent. It absorbs quickly, but still easy to spread across across your face and decollate without drying. It only takes a few seconds to dry down, so I don't have to wait long to layer on another serum. I've been using this a few weeks now and I feel like it has kept my acne away as well as kept my skin soft. I wouldn't say it's the most moisturizing serum I've come across, but it adds a small amount. The price is also really good for 2 full oz of serum. It comes with a pump, so it's not as messy as droppers. I would recommend this for anyone with any type of skin, sensitive and has acne to keep your skin clean and healthy

title: PURITO Galacto Niacin 97 Power Essence 2 fl.oz /92% galactomyces/fermented/Treatment essence/pore control
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2020
content:
I love this essence! I spreads very easily with its thin texture, is hydrating and makes my skin so soft.

The hard part about this essence is that the main ingredient can be sensitizing to some people, as you can see in other reviews. Sadly, skincare is not one size fits all, which really sucks. I would definitely recommend introducing this essence by itself for at least two weeks before/after switching anything in your routine. Do not add it if your skin is already irritated, you‚Äôll just be mad at yourself üò≠.

I had been using tretinoin for three months before I started using this, my skin was doing well and had acclimated to it at that point, no irritation. Omg, it changed the texture of my skin in only a few days! My skin got so soft and smooth. Yes, I know tretinoin is made to do this too, but it‚Äôs a little too coincidental for me for it to have improved that much at the same time as introducing this essence. I‚Äôve been using it for almost two months now and my skin is still as soft and smooth as when I started. Also, it has helped reduce my oil production because of the extra hydration and small amount of Niacinamide. I had trouble with The Ordinary Niacinamide serum drying me out and just making my face HURT, so I thought I was sensitive to it, but I think it was the formula and percentage of it that I had a problem with. So if you had the same problem, don‚Äôt be scared of trying this with it‚Äôs smaller percentage!

Oh, I almost forgot! I live in a dry climate with combination sensitive prone skin! I hope this helps!

EDIT: 2 years later

I am still in love with this essence, I once tried to stop using it about a year into using it to see if it was truly making a difference and it really does. I ordered it after a week of non use, because I couldn‚Äôt stand how quickly my fungal acne came back. I have to say it still does exactly what it did from the beginning. It keeps away all the little bumps from the fungal acne I get from all the sweating that happens living in the desert and still helps with my oil production.

title: PURITO Galacto Niacin 97 Power Essence 2 fl.oz /92% galactomyces/fermented/Treatment essence/pore control
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2020
content:
TLDR: this stuff is amazing. i use an antibacterial for acne at night and it dries my skin out a bit. but in the morning, i use this stuff to replenish the moisture barrier and microbiome on my skin and it has really been a game changer. i have used sk-ii and it wasnt nearly as good this in my opinion. i have very reactive skin including peri-oral dermatitis so i have to be really careful what i use - this causes no breakouts or irritation! i use it on my entire face, and then put moisturizinn cream only on targeted areas (rather than my whole face).

skin background and issues:
im in my 30s and my skin keeps changing, so i will think i have solved my problems and then new ones crop up. i have oily, acne prone skin that has become very sensitive and reactive. for a while, not washing my face but using micellar waters really helped, but not exfoliating ultimately led to a host of different problems. i used to be able to exfoliate all the time to even out tone and texture (which i know is ill-advised, but my point is that my skin used to love it) and now i can only do that once every week or two, but even then my skin would get upset at the trauma. i have tried chemical exfoliants as well as physical exfoliants and neither is ideal, but physical is slightly better but you can only do that so often. one chemical exfoliant i tried (recherche p50!) triggered peri-oral dermatitis around my mouth, nose, and eyes anyway, so that further limits my ability to exfoliate and what products i can use. anyway the accumulation of dead skin increases sebaceous filaments and other annoying skin issues to battle, plus the dermatitis, it's just been a nightmare. this stuff has really saved my skin! (after this product, i use Medicine Mama's Sweet Bee Magic All In One Healing Skin Cream on the spots with dermatitis followed by Weleda Calendula Diaper Rash Cream - my dermatitis is almost completely gone!!)

content: So I was using super luxury brands like Sulwhasoo or SK II which work great for my skin. But the Sulwhasoo was so heavily scented to the point that my husband has a hard time sitting next to me. Most of SK II products contain parabens which were off putting to me. I decided to try cheaper alternatives and I‚Äôm so glad I found Purito with short ingredient list and this is the only niacinamide serum I tried that doesn‚Äôt break me out (I do see some negative reviews about skin breaking out. So it‚Äôs likely the niacinamide causing flares or skin is just reacting to it). I‚Äôm ‚Äúallergic to vitamin c serums. It tends to cause rash or skin bumps on me. I‚Äôve been trying to find a vitamin c alternative and I think this is the real magic potion for me. I use it once daily at night with my tretinoin. And I wake up with really smooth skin and the tone is brighter after just a week. I will have to try it longer to see if it helps with fading the spots, but I go to a dermatologist to take care of my hyperpigmentation. I doubt if this serum really gets rid of stubborn dark spots. But it definitely made my skin softer and the tone is brighter. It doesn‚Äôt seem to work too well under my Mizon Bb cream. It doesn‚Äôt cause pilling but it has a shiny texture to it. So I only uses it at night. I‚Äôm not comparing this to the luxury skin care I used to use, but I‚Äôm pretty happy with the results so far and of course my wallet is a lot happier too!!

title: PURITO Pure Vitamin C Serum
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2020
content:
This is a great product for brightening up skin and fading hyperpigmentation. I have combination skin and the first time I used it, I had a slight tingling in on my cheek. After that there were no more reactions on the face. There was slight redness on my neck at the early stages of using this product, but that eventually dissipated. The smell wasnt the greatest but it goes away as soon as it‚Äôs applied to the face.

The biggest issue I have is how quickly the product oxidizes. It‚Äôs not clear whether it‚Äôs the product and/or how long it has been stored before shipping out that causes it to oxidize so quickly. I‚Äôve had this bottle for exactly 2 months before it oxidized as seen in the yellow color in the photo. I still have about one ounce left from a 2 ounce bottle after daily use for two months. It‚Äôs such a waste of a product to have to throw half a bottle away. Perhaps Purito could consider supplying smaller bottles to deter waste of products from oxidation. Only then will I consider buying this product again.

title: PURITO Pure Vitamin C Serum
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2020
content:
Skin Type: Very sensitive, combination skin. Mild rosacea. No major skin issues other than the occasional minor break out. User of retinoids.

This is a 10% concentrate of Vitamin C with 84% hyaluronic acid. In other words: this stuff is CONCENTRATED. I've tried Vitamin C serums from Maelove, Timeless, etc. and, whether its true by concentration of ingredients or not, this stuff definitely feels more potent because it stung when it first hit my face. So, if you're a beginner or have sensitivities to acids, I don't know if I would recommend this stuff. Having said that, I have sensitive skin and I love this stuff. I'd notice minor to moderate results with other Vitamin C serums, which is more in line with real world results. With this stuff I had noticeable results pretty quickly, which surprised me. Maybe its because of the hyaluronic acid, the formulation, or other ingredients. I'm not sure, but I will continue to use this stuff.

I also really, really love the pump bottle. The eye droppers with most vitamin C serums annoy me.

Regarding the smell: yes this serum does have a slight earthy smell to it, but it only lasts a few seconds.

Regarding the color of the serum: I ordered my Vitamin C serum from Purito's Amazon store front "PURITO KOREA". The serum I received was clear and seems 100% legit to me. I'm sure it will oxidise some over the next couple of weeks like many other serums. I will try and post an update.

title: PURITO Pure Vitamin C Serum
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2020
content: Have only used twice but my skin is definitely brighter. I have very crabby skin and this doesnt clog me at all! No white heads in the morning after using this! Yay. But it smells AWFUL üò© Fishy, so definitely oxidized.

title: PURITO Pure Vitamin C Serum
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2019
content:
edit: Now that I've used a different vitamin C product that works and isn't torturous, I have to downgrade this even further. While it did lighten and brighten, it caused a crazy amount of redness and irritation, smelled horrible, and oxidized within a few months even though I kept it in the fridge.
-----

This product has a really awful smell-- a metallic, meaty odor. When I first used it I didn't think I'd be able to get past the smell, but I eventually found a technique that works for me-- I apply a thin film of this in the morning to a dry face, then wait for it to completely dry on my skin. After that I apply moisturizer on top. This seals in the scent under the moisturizer. If you apply moisturizer before it is completely dry/absorbed, it mixes in with the moisturizer and you will smell the horrible hot dog odor all day. It does sting and makes my cheeks get a little bit red/irritated. However, I am also using Differin several nights/week so it may just be that my skin is unusually sensitive. The redness does calm down after about 20 minutes, though, and it helped by a light application of Aquaphor. This product does work, though! I definitely noticed fading of post-inflammatory hyperpigmentation (the dark spots that can follow acne) and an overall brightening effect. I poured 2/3 of the bottle out into a spare amber glass dropper bottle that I had and I keep that in the fridge so that it would last longer. As noted in the info above, the product does start out with a pale yellow color and according to Purito, it is still okay to use unless it oxidizes to the point where it is dark brown. This is the first vitamin C product I have used, so I'll bet there are more elegant formulations out there, but this works well and is reasonably priced.

title: PURITO Pure Vitamin C Serum
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2020
content:
I've been using this product for about 2 months and loving it so far. My skin is plumper, firmer and brighter overall. I don't see much improvement in my dark spots, but it generally takes time to fade them anyways, so I'll repurchase and see how it works over time. HOWEVER, I put 3 stars because it's got too much Hyaluronic Acid. I live in dry cold climate, so I don't want to put too much Hyaluronic Acid especially in winter. Well, regardless the weather/location, who needs that much Hyaluronic Acid anyways?? 89% is ridiculously high, IMO. It should be not too high nor low so that it works for everyone. If some hydrating/soothing ingredient (ie. green tea extract or water) is the first ingredient instead of Hyaluronic Acid, then I'll be purchasing this forever!

It depends on products, but the yellow color usually does NOT mean it's oxidized. I've used so many Vit C products, but they were all slight yellow when arrived. If the color turns more like orange, then it's oxidized. It's better to check the manufacturer's website or contact the on this to be 100% sure since it depends on products.

title: PURITO Bamboo Charcoal Konjac Sponge 100% vegan (Bamboo Charcoal)
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2020
content:
Konjac sponges became popular a few years back, but a majority of them were pretty overpriced and it made me never want to indulge. However I happened to be browsing one day and came across this sponge by Purito. I love their Green Level sunscreen and I decided to indulge as the price was fair and my face had been feeling a bit more congested than usual.

I have to say I have really been enjoying this sponge! I use this at night during my shower after my first cleanse to remove makeup and with my second cleanse facial wash. The texture is very interesting as it is rock hard when dry but turns into a very soft, mesh-like texture when wet. It very gently exfoliates - the domed side is more gentle while the flat side is a bit more rough. The instructions say not to use it one your face for too long and I can attest to that! The first time I used it I ended up scrubbing for too long and got some flaky skin around my nose and on my forehead (nothing moisturizer didn't fix). But that was my own fault because it felt so nice to use! When used the appropriate amount of time it leaves my face extra soft and smooth and I don't feel like my pores are congested anymore. I also like the shape of the sponge as it makes it easy to use on all the areas and crevices of your face. There is also a string attached to hang it while it dries. The only reason I am taking off a star is because even though I have been gentle with it, it is starting to flake off pieces after about two months. i know konjac sponges do not last forever, but depending how long this Purito one lasts I will update my review/rating. But if you are on the fence, buy it!

content: I absolutely love this sponge. It is soft and works well with any-kind of face cleaner. But u gotta let soak enough water.

content:
Ordered this a while back and used the entire tube.
As someone with psoriasis, eczema, and year-round dry skin: I wouldn't call this a "sleeping pack" or a "deep moisturizer" For me, this is a light hydrator like, I would consider it a daytime moisturizer. And it does work great with makeup! But for nighttime, it's not thick enough or moisturizing enough for my skin. Don't get me wrong- YES this is a great moisturizer ‚ù§Ô∏è it is hydrating, has a lovely scent, great texture. üòÄ It might be a great nighttime choice for someone with oily skin or severe acne. But I was having to layer this on with 2-3 quarter size amounts with 3 or 4 more products to get the advertised effect out of it so I probably won't buy again

I see it as a dupe for First Aid Beauty's moisturizer, just without some of the benefits it has for those of us with skin disorders.

title: PURITO Dermide Cica Barrier Sleeping Pack 2.7 fl.oz / 80ml ceramide and centella, night cream, sensitive type, moisture pack
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
content:
I love this sleeping pack, so much so that when I lost my bottle after traveling I came and bought another! At night, I use an active, serum, and Purito‚Äôs Oat-in moisturizer. But in the winter air, it‚Äôs sometimes not enough and I wake up with my face dry. So a few nights per week, I add in this Sleeping Pack as a final layer. When I wake up, I can still feel it a bit tacky on my face (in a good way) meaning it hasn‚Äôt completely dried out nor absorbed into my pillow, so I know my face is staying better moisturized overnight. It‚Äôs not sticky and doesn‚Äôt ‚Äústick‚Äù too much to my pillow either which is nice.

I also like to apply a layer before flying in the dry plane air and it keeps my face moisturized throughout the flight.

I‚Äôd describe the texture not so much as a sleeping pack but moreso as a ‚Äúheavier moisturizer‚Äù or a typical ‚Äúnight cream.‚Äù It‚Äôs a little thick but not uncomfortable or suffocating to wear. On nights that I use retinol, which dries my skin out, I mix in a little half-pea sized amount of aquaphor to make it even more occlusive and protect my skin from flaking. I‚Äôm thinking of trying the Purito ‚ÄúBarrier Balancing Balm‚Äù for retinol nights instead when I need to punch up the occlusiveness even more.

Overall a great heavier winter moisturizer for dry air. I love that it‚Äôs unscented and the quality for the price point is reasonable. A little goes a long way, too, - about a pea-sized amount is plenty to cover my whole face. So I‚Äôll have the bottle for quite some time and would definitely repurchase.

Day 2, same tingle but no change in appearance.
Day 3, I woke up with hives, and a swollen red face.

I 100% do not trust this brand. I have many products with the squalene, and I have never had this happen to me. I was given hydrocortisone to heal this rash.

I was trying out Drunk Elephant Protini moisturizer, and even it was too heavy for my oily, sensitive skin. This seems to be hitting the mark so far. I was using it on-and-off while sampling Protini, and now I‚Äôve been using it every night for a couple of weeks. No whiteheads like I got with Protini, a fresh unfragranced formula (unlike the Cicapair gel cream, which I‚Äôll admit does smell amazing), and it seems to calm my skin down. If only it had more anti-aging ingredients! It‚Äôs hard being in your mid-30s with oily, sensitive skin trying to avoid aging. (I use a niacinamide serum and CeraVe retinol serum, so there‚Äôs that. I highly recommend those for sensitive skin.)

title: PURITO Dermide Cica Barrier Sleeping Pack 2.7 fl.oz / 80ml ceramide and centella, night cream, sensitive type, moisture pack

content:
Normally I would wait a few weeks to write a review like this but I‚Äôm so excited I can‚Äôt wait. This practically cured my skin overnight!

After moving cities, I started experiencing the worst, most prolonged break out of my life. Mostly cystic, hormonal acne. My curology Dr. Added tretinoin to my treatment and it definitely helped but my skin is super sensitive and no product I owned was hydrating enough. My skin was so dry and flakey. I assumed my skin barrier had been compromised because even sensitive skin fragrance free (but drug store) moisturizers burned when I put them on. But one night of a generous application of this cream and I woke up with soft skin with no flakes and some of my post-acne spots noticeably faded.

It feels amazing to put on - definitely don‚Äôt need as much as I used. And it rubs in so nicely. The other night creams I‚Äôve tried are thicker and therefore harder to rub in (and that rubbing probably doesn‚Äôt help the irritation). It is truly fragrance free. I just can‚Äôt wait until tonight to use it again!

I seriously cannot recommend this to people with sensitive, dry skin enough. It‚Äôs a game changer.

date: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2023
content:
I got this serum in the cica trial pack and decided to get a full bottle. (The toner is also nice.) It came in really handy when I developed sensitive, dehydrated skin this winter. I had weakened my skin barrier. My face was burning and a lot of my products made my face sting. This product was a godsend, since nothing worked. It calmed and soothed my skin. This serum is fairly thick and I slathered it on. I left it on like a mask, and let it absorb into the skin.

I was able to heal my skin barrier by adding a ceramide serum and probiotics. Unfortunately, this serum only has one ceramide.

If you have dry or dehydrated skin, you will have to apply a moisturizer to prevent the moisture from sleeping out. I always apply a drop of squalane oil when I am done applying my k beauty products to prevent any stickiness or tacky feeling on the skin. Jojoba, argan, or another oil would also work.

date: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2021
content:
UPDATE 5/11: I just finished my first bottle and I'm about to buy another one because I adore this stuff. I just noticed the reviews stating that it has witch hazel, and it may have in the past but it does not as of when I first posted my review in late 2021. If you have dry/sensitive skin, this should absolutely be in your daily routine along with a good set of day and night moisturizers.
I tried using witch-hazel-based toners, micellar water, and astringents too many times to count. The witch hazel and astringents were all too harsh and too drying and the micellar water did nothing at all. My skin is currently VERY dry. Even though this toner feels like nothing going on, it's super calming and hydrating and you can see the excess dirt that it is able to pick up on your cotton pad. I wash my face thoroughly, so that's how I know it's working. Not only that, but the next day after using this for the first time, my skin was 80% less dry!! I bought this product with my own money, I'm just raving about it because it worked miracles for me. It dries quickly without leaving the skin sticky or any kind of residue.

title: PURITO Centella Unscented Toner, 200ml 6.76 fl.oz, Korean Centella, for Sensitive Skin, Soothing, Facial Toner for face, K-Beauty, Korean Skin Care
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2022
content:
I have purchased many bottles. I have dehydrated combination skin that is very sensitive.

This is great for all skin types. It's hydrating and doesn't make my forehead greasy. I apply multiple layers for extra hydration. It's great for soothing itching or stinging. I also use it as a diy toner mask.

If you have acne, you will love this. The cica calms redness and helps acne scars heal. I had a really nasty scar from popping. I applied this with the recovery serum and the scab came off in 2-3 days, plus a toner mask for 5 minutes. I genuinely thought I would have a permanent brown mark.

Personally, I prefer the original scented formula. It seems more refreshing and soothing to me, but I always buy the unscented because it's better for my sensitive skin. I try to cut out essential oils if it feels irritated.

It might seem sticky or tacky to some, but I don't have this problem. That is common with K-beauty products that have little or no oil. I usually finish with a mist of plain water or a drop of squalane oil to aid absorption. I have also found that using less product and waiting before applying the next product really helps. If you have too much product and too many layers, you will get tackiness and pilling.

title: PURITO From Green Deep Foaming Cleanser 150ml / 5.07 fl.oz, pH 5.5, plant-based, natural ingredients, cruelty-free, Vegan
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2020
content: This face wash is amazing! Does everything it says it should; super gentle, hydrating, and fragrance free! I have normal to dry skin so this face wash was super hydrating for me. As far as sensitivity goes, I know there are some people who have EXTREMELY sensitive skin so i can't speak for them, but for me this was very non irritating. My skin is moderately sensitive so i needed a face wash that would gently cleanse without irritating it with fragrance and other irritating ingredients and this one definitely came through. I've tried some pretty irritating face washes before that claimed to be all natural or organic but they made my skin either itch, tingle, or burn, and this one did none of those things whatsoever. It foams up perfectly; not too little or too much. Since my skin is kind of dry, i need a hydrating face wash that will cleanse my skin without stripping it, but i prefer a foaming cleanser to a cream and this is perfect for my skin. I was a little worried about some of the reviews that said this face wash was stripping to the skin but as soon as i tried it out, i found that it wasn't stripping at all. I love how basic and clean the ingredient list is and how affordable this product is! A little goes a long way so this will last me awhile. I've tried some of PURITO'S other products and have never had a problem with them either. I also love that this is ph balanced so it won't wreck your skins natural moisture barrier. I'm overall a big fan of this brand and would purchase this product again as long as they don't change the formula. I'd give this face wash a 10/10!

title: PURITO [ESSENTIAL OIL-FREE Sea Buckthorn Vital 70 Cream 50ml / 1.7 fl.oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2020
content:
I've been a big fan of the Purito Unscented Centella Sunscreen, and I was very excited to find this new essential oil-free formulation of their sea buckthorn moisturizer. I really like the idea of sea buckthorn for skin in theory, and this was the first product I got to try it out in. I am thrilled!! This is nearly entirely free of any scent, and has the perfect cream gel texture that absorbs quickly and is fairly non greasy. Most importantly, I can wear this on top of serums and under sunscreen in 90+F, 50+% humidity, and it doesn't clog my pores and make a sweaty mess.

Additionally, I have combo, sensitive skin, and this is a dream in terms of skin comparability! Even many "sensitive skin" products give me redness and a burning sensation, but this product feels soothing and does not make me break out. Well done, Purito!

The product did however come in the old box for the essential oil formulation so for a second I thought they sent me the wrong product, but inside was the new version so I am glad they are recycling their packaging I guess. This is great for brightening the skin and is in a gel texture so your skin doesn't get oily as quickly as if you were using a cream.

title: PURITO [ESSENTIAL OIL-FREE Sea Buckthorn Vital 70 Cream 50ml / 1.7 fl.oz
date: Reviewed in Canada on February 22, 2024
content:
This Purito sea buckthorn gel cream is very light and non-greasy. It absorbs very quickly into my skin, without any "residue" feeling being left on my skin. The cream is white, which surprised me as other sea buckthorn products I've used have been bright orange. At least with this one being white - I can wear it places other than just my house, as it's invisible on my skin. The cream is unscented. I've been wearing this cream as a step in my regular skin care routine, and it is playing well with my other skincare. Unlike a silicone based cream, this one doesn't pill when I put moisturizer/makeup/sunscreen overtop. I have dull, aging, combination skin that has a tendency to be sensitive. This cream is super light and doesn't clog my pores, and unlike vitamin c cream, it doesn't make my skin sting, it's very gentle. Has not caused any sensitivity for me. I do wear a moisturizer with this cream, as it isn't moisturizing enough on its own, at least not in wintertime.
This cream is vegan and not tested on animals. It comes in a tube made from recycled plastic. It contains sea buckthorn and niacinamide, which I'm hopeful in time should brighten up my dull skin. All good things! This cream is powerful yet gentle - I like it.

title: PURITO Fermented Complex 94 Boosting Essence 150ml/5.1fl.oz Skincare Booster,safe ingredients, Natural, soothing, Fermentation
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2023
content:
Came back and added a star - really loving this brand and I reordered this essence. Affordable but very nice and my skin loves it. Will be ordering more Purito (and I just reordered this after not using it for a while and so glad I did - my skin loves it! Purito, Cosrx, Beauty of Joseon, and TirTir are such beautiful skincare brands.)
-----

I use this as my third step in my skincare routine: cleanse, spray toner, and then this essence. I usually use a reusable cotton pad to apply it to my face after cleansing. It's watery/thin as essences are supposed to be more watery versions of their thicker serum sisters.

I have no irritation to my skin, even with my slight rosacea-prone skin.

This is my second Purito product to try and I love that they are affordable options. Their squalane oil is wonderful - I use it last in my routine to seal in everything and I'm sad they don't have it any longer.

Just keep in mind that this isn't supposed to be thick like a moisturizer or serum, but is made to be thin. If you are doing skincare steps, whether your own, or K-Beauty Skincare routine, or something in between, then using this after your toner and before your serum, and then whatever other products you use after serum, your skin will love you for it - if you skin can handle multiple products that is! Always test out a product first. I've found, so far, that Purito has been gentle enough for me.

Thanks for reading and take care of your skin - when you reach my age (60s) you'll be glad you did! I wish I'd have known 10, 15, or 20 years ago what I know now! So many options now. So much more information - take advantage of it and love your skin -- and you don't have to spend a lot to do it! Just do your research and have fun.

title: PURITO Fermented Complex 94 Boosting Essence 150ml/5.1fl.oz Skincare Booster,safe ingredients, Natural, soothing, Fermentation
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2022
content:
My skin is sensitive, delicate, in great condition but can turn dry and crepey quickly from products that contain alcohol, dimethicone, xanthan gum, vitamin C, pineapple, grape seed extract, grapefruit extract), oil from the pit of stone fruit (they contain cyanide), low grade glycerin (glycerin contains lye). I have been buying and testing Japanese and Korean beauty products happily. They work effectively. The benefits of using them show in the result of beautiful, healthy skin.

The first time I used this Essence I was shocked at how fast and completely it removed patches of dry skin that came from a moisturizer I bought after watching Selena Gomez show her skincare routine (she has dry skin). That moisturizer created patches of dry skin wherever I had applied it. Lucky for me the Essence arrived a few days later to rescue my distressed skin. The Essence instantly hydrated my skin, brightened, and healed it. The next morning I was astonished to see clear baby skin.

But after using this Essence for a few weeks I learned to use it alone after washing my face. It works fantastically to hydrate, moisturize and heal by itself. When I use a serum, toner, or moisturizer over it, my face and neck will break out in little bumps under the surface of the skin.

Also, it works best when it is NOT used daily. Alternating this Essence with BIBA de Sousa Plant Stem Cell Serum W. Peptides and Purito Centella Unscented Serum will result in super star unbelievably GORGEOUS skin! No moisturizer is necessary! This Essence and serums do not clog my pores.

No matter how light and refined a moisturizer, I only recently discovered moisturizers enlarge and clog pores. While microblading my face I was horrified to see the lightweight WHITE moisturizer pop out of pores and cling to the length of the blade as I swept it across my face! I had mistakenly believed moisturizers were totally absorbed into our skin. Now I know they do not get absorbed. They sit in and clog and enlarge our pores!
Sometimes great results come from decluttering products and multiple steps. I highly recommend simple steps. Quality products, like this Essence. A+++++.

title: PURITO Fermented Complex 94 Boosting Essence 150ml/5.1fl.oz Skincare Booster,safe ingredients, Natural, soothing, Fermentation
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2020
content:
Update: This is now my go-to after trying cult favorites (because who doesn‚Äôt want to try ALL the face products?).

-Missha Time Revolution is nice but I definitely think this makes my skin smoother and more supple. I feel like I need less of this to accomplish more.
-HadaLabo Goku Jyun isn‚Äôt that impressive to me, especially after trying Purito Boosting. My skin‚Äôs left feeling dry from it whereas Purito Boosting leaves my skin much softer.

The Purito is great for sensitive acne-prone skin like mine, and it never leaves my skin oily anytime of day. It plays nice under my other products regardless of brand. I DEFINITELY RECOMMEND THIS!! Oh, and I‚Äôm 43, & this has definitely helped my skin to age gracefully!!

* I DID NOT RECEIVE ANYTHING FOR THIS REVIEW, IT SEEMS IMPORTANT TO SAY THAT GIVEN HOW MANY FAKES ARE OUT THERE :)

Original: This stuff is really good. I‚Äôve used other essences before, but this is the first ‚Äústarting essence‚Äù I ever used. I did lots of research on the top products most recommended (Sk-II, Missha, Secret Key), and somehow landed on this one despite it not being rated as highly/often as the others. I simply liked the ingredients better (actually, I liked the fact I could find an English ingredient list more easily than the competitors).

So, while I can‚Äôt compare this to others, I do know it feels incredibly soft the moment it touches my skin. My skin drinks it up, & despite how watery & wet it feels going on, it dries as quickly as I hoped it would. As it dries while I rub it in, my skin feels so smooth.

I haven‚Äôt been using it long enough to speak of long term results, but I do know my skin has a very healthy glow to it now. Even if I‚Äôm fighting hormonal acne in some places, my unaffected skin still looks so good. I‚Äôm excited to see what transformations occur as time goes on. If I see lightening effects & a decrease in hormonal acne, I will definitely repurchase this. It‚Äôs got very healthy ingredients and no bad stuff thrown in with it.

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2023
content:
Cons: I'll start with the only con which is their limited shade range. However I'm lucky to have found a great shade match. I'm wearing 21, which is a fair/light true neutral beige color. I feel a lot of the review photos do not do this shade justice as it looks a lot less grey dry vs wet. Sure it might look ashy on some people but if you're very neutral and beige like me and everything seems too orange, yellow, or pink then try this out. Know your skin color theory!

Coverage: this actually has good coverage for a bb cream. It's definitely buildable. I'm only wearing one layer in the photo and my freckles are slightly coming through. I would say it's medium coverage.

Texture: this gives a skin like texture. It is the best foundation I've own, I don't even need a primer. It doesn't highlight my dry spots or enlarged pores. I have some fine lines around my mouth and it doesn't settle. Ive heard it works well on oily and dry skin. I have combination... Update! My 60 year old mother tried this in shade 27 and this looks great on her mature skin. We used the finger method to blend out. She is Afrolatina with light warm caramel skin. This was a good shade for her.

Note for oily people: just updating my review because I used this product in a tropical climate. In tropical climates my skin becomes more oily. However, I still liked this bb cream! It gives me a healthy glow, it stayed on through the sweat even though I had no setting powder. I also am updating this review with a photo of me in the tropics. Remember folks the finish is dewy like most Korean skin products. Saw someone say it's not for oily people but I think it depends more what type of finish you prefer. I agree if you are a matte girly this product may not be for you.

Overall this is the best bb cream and foundation Ive ever worn. It performs better then expensive brands like Nars and Armani for me. For the price it's worth a shot. Just please make more shades so I can recommend this to my friends!

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2024
content: I have extra oily skin, with pale yellow to olive undertones. #13 Neutral Ivory is a great shade match for me, despite the name. It's light enough that it doesn't give me an orange tinted face, and I see no traces of pink or peach undertones. Would never guess my shade by its name. It is not gray at all. Doesn't leave demarcation lines, so I don't even have to blend it on my even paler neck. I'm using only about a pea sized amount on my whole face and it makes my skin look so good. Covers what it needs to cover, but my skin is still visible. Sits well on the skin, looks natural or even healthy and doesn't cling to dry spots when those are present. Does not look cakey on me. It won't melt off from my super oily face even when having it on for the whole day in the summer heat. By the end of the day it won't look its best due to my oils showing through, but it is still presentable without any touch up. Great price and perfect shade match.

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2024
content:
I was really skeptical when I was looking for a dupe of my favorite but discontinued foundation, and this was suggested. I got it and tried swatching it a few times on my face and felt like it did absolutely nothing, but yesterday had some extra time so I did a full face using a brush instead of my fingers and OMG it's amazing!

I will agree that the shade is a little on the gray side, but I'd prefer that over it making me look orange. It's also VERY lightweight, to the point where I almost forgot I was wearing it! The only thing that I felt "weighing down my face" was my contour/blush. I have really sensitive skin, and eczema on my face, and this is one of the first foundations/bb creams that has not caused me to break out (normally do within an hour or so), and was very easy to reapply and blend in on my eczema spots since nothing is going to last there for 8+ hours.

Overall very impressed and happy with this! Also I feel it should be noted that applying it with a brush gave enough coverage that while wasn't FULL full coverage, I did not feel the need to use any concealer! Like yes, I had some acne spots that showed through it, but they were raised and would've been noticeable with our without concealer, and I was putting blush over them anyways which negated the need for concealer.

content: For the price, I am really impressed. I wish we had more shades to pick from. The color is a little off. It does get a little patchy in certain areas throughout the day, but it's not bad. Love this company and love that they're cruelty free.

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2024
content: The look of this stuff is amazingly skin like and it wears beautifully all day. My skin tends to break down a lot of foundations, but not really this one. It's also fairly hydrating. Has a nice, lightly glowy finish, though I like to powder. The drawback though, is that the shades all have wildly strong undertones and are fairly dark. #21 is aggressively gray pink and more for light-medium skin. #13 is like a strong peach, but it's about 3 shades too dark on me (m.u.f.e. r210ish). I have to mix this 50/50 with a white mixer, which is sad because it alters the finish for the worse. I'll keep wishing for a more proper shade range here, but if you're in the middle of the shade spectrum, you'll have luck.

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2024
content:
This is my first bb/cc cream of any kind, and an Asian brand at that. From my understanding, some of the Asian branded ones are just like this one, where you squeeze the tube and what comes out looks like gray clay rather than anything resembling human skin color. The magic happens once you apply it to your face - the color changes to your skin tone somehow and at the same time, hides any redness that you have. I have a bunch of redness around the nose from broken capillaries and this makeup just covers it up like medium to full coverage foundation. My face ends up looking very even in tone and has that polished dewy look like I just slaved for 30 minutes putting on all kinds of makeup products to achieve this very look. I'm quite happy that I can get that look with just this product because I am definitely not a makeup person!

One thing that will take some time for me to get used to is the initial tackiness. It takes about 15 minutes for the tackiness to go away so your face doesn't feel like a sticky mess. You definitely still feel like you're wearing makeup, but after that point, your hair is safe from sticking to your face. Also, I don't trust the sunscreen protection of these makeup products, so I tend to apply a real sunscreen beforehand (if you're doing this, you should wait about 15 min for the sunscreen to sink in before applying this cream).

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2022
content: I love Purito products and use it for all but one step of my skin care regimen. I so wanted to be able to use their BB cream, but the shade range was too limited so I was glad to see #31 bc 27 was too light for me. Sure enough 31 is too dark BUT mixing 27 and 31 using about a 2:1 ratio (31 to 27) I was able to get a closer match. I noticed after a week of use that the spf worn under this makes a difference ie any spf with the slightest white case and I‚Äôll need a little more 31 to offset the ghost show. The most important thing I noticed is warming the BB cream (mixing the two shades rubbing my fingers together as shown in their video) made a huge difference in the smoothness of the application and the color match. Purito‚Äôs video demonstrating how to apply is spot on. Depending on the ratio used, a mix of 27 and 31 should create shades from NC42-NW55. I initially thought the leap from 27 to 31 wasn‚Äôt quite right, but now I see it allows for a greater shade range, if you are willing to mix until you find what works for you. I also noticed some calming of minor irritations after a week of use so, it‚Äôs kind to my skin. I hope they continue to expand the shade range in both directions so everyone can find their match because it‚Äôs a good product - covers just enough blemishes to still look natural, blurs pores a bit too. If I use too much it highlights my pores so I stick to a light application. Worth a try‚Ä¶

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2023
content: I have searched high and low for a foundation that looked natural on my skin, and fully covered my acne scarring and active acne. I have purchased almost every foundation you can think of, to never be fully satisfied with the way the makeup sat on my skin. It always looked unnatural, and I started to think the problem was ME and not the foundations. When I tried this product, I had little to no expectation that it would actually work and look beautiful on my face. I bought it on a whim because it was cheap and I wanted to try out some Korean products to see what they were about. Aaaand this is why you should never judge a book by its cover/price tag. Amazon tells me I have purchased this product 15 times, but it‚Äôs really been way more than that because I originally starting ordering it off of YesStyle before I realized I could find it on Amazon. I‚Äôve been wearing this for a few years now, almost daily. People always comment on how glowy my face looks (even after setting with powder). It looks so natural sometimes people don‚Äôt even think I wear makeup. I have very fair skin and pink undertones, and always purchase shade #21(light beige). It goes on pretty dark so it can look kind of scary at first but I promise it dries down so wonderfully. I will continue to order this until it‚Äôs discontinued or no longer available. I won‚Äôt even waste my time or money trying anything else. I waited so long to write this review because I want to keep this product my own little secret but it seems like the secret‚Äôs already out. Try it !!!

Throw out your foundation and use this!

date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
content:
Lmao I‚Äôm writing this review like a year after buying this product but I was talking to my sister about how much I liked it and searched it up in my orders to show her and decided to leave a review

Anyway - from a dry skinned girly - this foundation is so comfortable and light and I need so little of it to even put my skin tone this sounds dramatic but it‚Äôs honestly my personal favorite foundation I‚Äôve ever tried and I‚Äôve tried a LOT of affordable, light foundations. I‚Äôm a light skinned person, so it‚Äôs obviously easier for me to find the shade that I want in foundation, so I may keep that in mind if you have an especially dark or light complexion (the lightest shade is too dark for my very pale sister, but she‚Äôs like a sheet of paper so she may be an outlier haha) anyway big recommend if they have your shade the formula is just wonderful

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2022
content:
‚Ä¶ olfactory-sensitive folks.

This BB cream applies nicely with fingers, then pounced over with a damp beauty sponge (that‚Äôs been wrung out in an absorbent towel first). But even the lightest shades wouldn‚Äôt suit a fair-skinned person.

Also, it‚Äôs more opaque than I would‚Äôve expected‚Äînot a bad thing, necessarily‚Äîand thicker upon application, but using maybe a pea-sized amount to cover the face would do which unfortunately makes this unsuitable for proper sun protection. Basically you can go for an overdone-makeup look to properly utilize the sunscreen aspect of the product (and might as well with how strong the physical sunscreen/titanium dioxide smell is‚Äîwhich doesn‚Äôt fade at all to me throughout the day‚Äîbecause that‚Äôll surely stick with you), or you get a nice-looking BB cream without the sun protection if you apply it in a natural-looking amount‚Ä¶

So best case scenario: This product is amazing for someone who wants to start using sunscreen, and doesn‚Äôt want a lot of layers underneath to achieve a full-face makeup look. If you live closer to the Equator, I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this as a primary form of sun protection.

For me, I‚Äôm just going to stick with the Dr. Jart Camo Drops for natural-looking coverage with some sun protection and maybe use this on the days I want heavier skin camouflaging, still with ‚Äúsome‚Äù sun protection; and on outdoorsy days, I‚Äôll make sure to use EltaMD‚Äôs UV RESTORE (zinc oxide-based = better healing properties and no stinky sunscreen smell) physical sunscreen partnered with either listed-above tinted sunscreens for proper protection.

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2023
content:
I was previously just using a tinted SPF but wanted something that offered more coverage while still moisturizes, for days where I'd like to do a full makeup look. I'm so glad I discovered BB creams as opposed to standard foundation. And this cream is a joy to put on, it really is stunning coverage and blends super well with my skin. But it's also extremely key that my skin is perfectly prepared for it, i.e. clean and hydrated, allowing for a seamless dewy effect, otherwise it can look a little dry. Other than a good night's rest, I typically can ensure my skin is prepped with the double cleanse method where I start with a cleansing oil, followed by a sheet mask if I feel my skin could use a little extra help. Then I lock in moisture with COSRX Snail Mucin Cream followed by Then I Met You Sunscreen. Once dried, I apply this BB cream with my fingertip, starting slow with small amounts.

I worried the Light Beige would be too dark for my skin but as others mention, it really blends well and is a lovely color on fair skin. Highly recommend, and hope my tips can help any who struggle to reap this beautiful product's benefits.

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
content: I have very dry skin and prefer the dewy wet look so BB/CC creams are my version of full face makeup and foundation: sheer enough to still see some freckles and not feel caked. I mix a little bit of this tinted cream with my Babo Botanicals tinted SPF liquid and emollient Eucerin face moisturizer and it goes a long way. It's gentle and doesn't make me break out. I have fair-warm skin with pinkish undertones and strawberry blonde/auburn hair so I like this color-- especially for summer when I opt for a bit of a tanned glow. After it dries down I don't worry much about a bunch rubbing off, I've had very little transfer when I put a shirt on or get close to someone. Overall I think this formula is better than most everything else I've tried all the way from Tarte to Andalou Naturals!

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2024
content: Not sure why the ratings are so low on this, I really love it. The key is finding the right shade, if you‚Äôre light skinned and have redness, Rose Ivory is probably it. I also had to find the right level of moisture. Right after moisturizer is a bit too early and slick, but don‚Äôt wait til it‚Äôs fully absorbed/dry. And I find it‚Äôs pretty easy to fix with a very light serum spray if needed. Also less is more! This has the best, most natural coverage of a ton of other brands that are way more expensive and lasts a good while. Just my 2c!

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted

content: Love how lightweight and yet there is a medium amount of coverage. I also love the ingredients. Recommend for sure!

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2023
content:
I bought this in hopes that it could replace my NARS tinted moisturizer. On first application I could tell that I preferred the finish of this product compared to my NARS one. It‚Äôs a little more matte, a little higher coverage, and I haven‚Äôt gotten any pulling with it over top of my La Roche Posay SPF and clindamycin lotion (which occasionally was an issue with my NARS product).

The color match is also really good. I have YELLOW toned skin. Not warm, not golden, simply yellow and extremely neutral-olive. NARS radiant creamy concealer in macadamia is probably my closest shade match, but they don‚Äôt carry that same color in the tinted moisturizer. The #13 neutral ivory of the Purito BB is a very good match to my skin. It‚Äôs yellow, but not in an overly warm way.

Only downside is that there‚Äôs no SPF but I might prefer it that way because I feel like it layers with other products better without it, and I use SPF in my face lotion anyway.

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted

content:

I can put it on in spots and you wouldn‚Äôt even know where it stops and my bare skin starts! I love this product so much! My skin leans more oily and I find that it sits really well and haven‚Äôt had any issues with it wearing away or anything like that. I‚Äôve always just picked the lightest neutral or cool shade I could find, but they always left me kind of orange, especially around my neck. I‚Äôd say this is light medium coverage. I included a couple pictures in different lighting. Picture 1:direct daylight from the window on a cloudy day. Picture 2: natural window light on a clear day. Picture 3: room light with no flash. Picture 4: room light with flash.

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2023
content: Buy this!!! I love this BB cream! Since my department store color ‚Äòs formula changed I have had the hardest time finding a good match. Also as my skin is aging my skin is drier and I have melasma/dark spots. This foundation gives a beautiful slightly dewy smooth finish. It is not cakey at all and the coverage is awesome. Coverage is more in the lines of a foundation than a BB cream and is buildable. At first it feels a bit thick but you can use very little and smooth it out for a lighter coverage. I add a layer over my dark spots/melasma and it covers it beautifully. I‚Äôve tried color correctors, multiple high end foundations, and concealers and this BB cream beats them all. I have olive skin (I‚Äôm half Italian) and need a warm tone (golden undertone not pink). Before this the closest shade I could find was the bottle pictured in a 4.5 neutral. It is a touch too pink but works ok‚Ä¶but this BB cream beats it in finish, coverage and color match after mixing two colors. I use mostly color #27 Sand beige and mix in a small bit of color #13 Natural Ivory. I cleaned out an old foundation bottle and squirted in the BB cream and mixed with the pump tube of the bottle. Also my bottle had a couple beads in it to help mix. A few good stirs and shakes and it‚Äôs perfect. It‚Äôs very close to the 4.5 bottle pictured but more warm than neutral. Perfect for olive skin. I love that I‚Äôll be able to adjust color for summer and winter if I get darker from sun etc. I am thrilled with the flawless natural look and coverage of this BB cream. Love everything about it. I get so many complements and have recommended it to family and friends. Added some pics of the two colors next to samples I had to help compare colors to other shades. Hope it helps.

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2024
content: I have tan skin with yellow undertones and I got the neutral ivory. It looms great after it settles‚Äîdon‚Äôt be scared of the initial white cast! It lasts all day and feels so light. I took a star off bc it‚Äôs not very buildable.

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2022
content:
I am 51 with dry skin, red hair, freckles, and fair skin. I watched a review of this BB cream a long time ago (Geek Out of Water on YouTube) and had it on my list for a long time. This week I finally decided to try it.

(FYI, the foundation comes out of the tube a shade or two darker than it actually is. It dries much lighter.)

I am amazed at how natural it looks. In a liquid foundation, I typically wear L‚ÄôOreal True Match Nude, but after a side-by-side comparison, I can see that the True Match is actually streaky and is too matte, making me look dry. I never realized it!

The Purito is just wonderful. It has a radiant finish (not too radiant, mind you ‚Äî just an inner glow), and I can layer it without it looking cakey. No other foundation I‚Äôve tried does that!

It covers much better than I thought it would. It almost erases my freckles! Yet it‚Äôs not heavy.

Plus, this stuff actually looks better than my BareMinerals ‚Äî and it‚Äôs so affordable! Wow!!!

(I wear the shade Fairly Light in BareMinerals original powder foundation, if you want to know my coloring for reference. In the Purito I am shade #21.)

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2024
content: I was hesitant on which color would work best. Watched a few Youtubers review and went with shade 21, which appears greyish. Love it. slides on with a brush. This has great coverage and evens out my complexion. I do apply powder over top in some areas to prevent transfer.

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2023
content:
I used to use the Garnier BB cream, and unfortunately they stopped making it. Since they canceled it, I have tried 5 different products with no luck at all. All of the products melted off my face. Several of them seemed to really highlight my pores. Several of them were just too dark for my skin type, in addition to the other issues. It's so frustrating and disappointing not being able to find anything that looked decent, and it was embarrassing to wear in public. All of those products have been moved to my yard work collection that I've never had nor needed before.

This product has finally answered all of my problems. It's not too thick, it doesn't melt off, and it lasted ALL DAY! Not only that, it is almost the perfect shade for me. It is ever so slightly lighter, but that is better than looking orange. I am very happy with this product and only hope they don't discontinue this too.

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2023
content: Not advertised as a sunscreen, but it has several ingredients in it that are typically associated with sunscreen. I'm unsure it has enough of the "good" ingredients for it to noticeably improve your skin. However, coverage is very decent for a tinted moisturizer, and finding a pink based tone is difficult in most brands. Bobbi Brown says that's because only 1% of women need a pink tone, but when you're out in the sun, it's normal to turn pink, not yellow. It won't fully cover acne, but it helps even things out. With concealer and powder on top, it looks like you're wearing a light to medium foundation. No cakeyness that I noticed; it won't emphasize your pores. Don't expect a miracle, but for the price point, you could do far worse.

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2021
content:
I saw a lot of reviews that stated this didn't help in terms of oil control, and that it felt greasy on the skin for most users. Upon using this for the past 5 days, I can state that this product is not meant for oily skin. If you have oily skin, it will reject this product and transfer on your mask or hands. I used to have oily acne-prone skin, and now I have normal to dry skin. It wasn't greasy or oily for me at all.

This BB cream melted into my skin and actually stayed there without needing to use any setting spray. While I pumped it out, I was shocked to see that the color didn't match the packaging in the slightest. It was brownish/gray, but once you put it on the skin, it's as if it blends into your color and gets away any unevenness, including redness. I tested this on the back of my hand before putting it on my skin to see how it would oxidize. Again, I noticed a very weird brown color oxidation but it goes away. When I put it on my face, there are no lines or oxidizing. It turned out being a perfect shade match after all.

This BB cream gives you a plump to the skin, a glow, and a very youthful look. I was also shocked to see that it has medium/buildable coverage. You can wear it sheer but a small pump of product goes a long way. It's easy to blend and I didn't need to moisturize or prime beforehand. I cant imagine how well it would work had I prepped beforehand. Just seeing how well it worked without prepping is a good sign for me!

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2022
content:
This product is amazing. Recently I‚Äôve tried to shift to less face makeup (foundation, powder) because no matter what brand, what price, how much was applied, it would always end up creasing somewhere and just amplifying rough or bumpy textures. I also really wanted to let my skin breathe and I love Purito, so I decided to try it out.

I can‚Äôt explain how much I love this! I‚Äôve tried a few BB/ CC creams before and they were really tacky/ sticky or too thick and never worked for me. This feels like a moisturizer and made my skin look so glowy and fresh. I got shade #13 and it is a perfect match for me. I am verrrry pale with neutral to warm undertones so it‚Äôs hard for me to find a product light enough that still match my undertones.

I apply a thin layer of this, warm it up and apply with my fingers first and then blend with a beauty blender. Then I just dot concealer where I need it and use a tiny bit of translucent powder over just my oily areas. It actually looks so much better than foundation (in my opinion) and doesn‚Äôt feel drying.

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted

content: I was looking for something that is light & just covers my hyperpigmentation & let me tell you this is perfect for that!!! Covers all my acne scars, & feels so lightweight! Perfect for summer! Such a steal for the price too! A little goes a long way & it‚Äôs very buildable!

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted

I usually mix this half and half with the Rose Ivory shade to match my skin tone, and apply it with a damp sponge. It delivers amazing coverage, better than my foundation (Clinique Superbalanced), and it‚Äôs the best option when my skin breaks out.

Although it has sunscreen filters, I don‚Äôt rely on it at all for sun protection. There‚Äôs no way I could apply 1/4 tsp to my face without looking like I‚Äôm wearing a mask, which is why I apply it with a damp sponge to sheer it out. It feels heavier than most foundations, and it definitely transfers! But it provides great coverage and it‚Äôs really fast to apply on weekends/days when I‚Äôm in a hurry and just want to improve the look of my skin without putting on any other makeup.

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2022
content:
I found out about this product from a YouTube video and from suggestions on a Facebook beauty group.

I'm fair to light neutral in face products and #21 is a perfect match. I'm 63 years old, with dry skin, minimal pores, and mild rosacea on my cheeks.

This product doesn't appear dry on my dry areas, applies smoothly, and lasts all day.

I do have to mention that I use hydrating products on my face before applying any foundation or BB creams. I use a serum, moisturizer with one or two drops of face oil, followed by SPF lotion. I use face primer only on occasion, when I remember. I always use the face oil with my moisturizer everyday, because I have very dry skin. This is what makes my makeup apply smoothly, regardless of the brand of foundation. I do exfoliate twice a week and that helps with smooth application.

I noticed some other people mention it looks "grey" on first application. It does NOT look grey on me and blends beautifully into the neutral tone I need to cover up my redness.

I love this product and will definitely repurchase.

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted

content:
I‚Äôve been looking for some light coverage lately and found this stuff! It got pretty good reviews and depending what you‚Äôre looking for, this could either work or not.

content: I was expecting it to be a light coverage but it's more of a med-full. I usually wear neutral but the #23 was a tad too light for my skin, but not obvious enough to see the difference unless you really look. If I were to repurchase I would go up a shade next time.

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2022
content: I'd heard great things about this Purito BB Cream, that it was hydrating, had great coverage, lasted a good long while, etc. Typically, I use a dampened beauty sponge or sometimes a foundation brush to apply my foundations/BB/CC creams, but I just used my fingers when I tried it today for the first time. It spreads beautifully and evenly, covered my sun spots and discoloration, didn't gather in my lines and wrinkles (67 years old, dry sensitive skin and yes, lines and some wrinkles), basically everything good I'd heard and more. My complexion looks dewy and glowing, it's so easy to apply, and although at first when I squeezed it out of the tube the color looked a little dark for my fair skin (for reference, I use Estee Lauder shade 1C1 cool bone, or L'oreal Age Perfect serum foundation in Rose Ivory #15), once it spread, the shade was just about perfect. This is a beautiful BB Cream with great coverage, good skincare ingredients in it, moisturizing (more moisturizing I think than the Missha BB cream), sun protection, and the price is right. I highly recommend and will continue to purchase!

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2021
content:
UPDATE: I don't know what kind of magic this stuff contains, but it actually matches fairly well. Guess I was wrong! It has pretty decent coverage too. Doesn't settle into my lines too badly either. It does feel a little heavy on the skin though, so I have to use it sparingly. END UPDATE

I haven't tried it on my face yet, but it is SO dark! I'm used to any Korean BB cream in the shade 21 being exactly the right shade for my fair neutral skin, but this is completely different. It also really settled into the fine lines on my arm, so I worry about what it will do on my 38 year old face. I was really excited about this product and I'm pretty bummed. It also seems pretty matte for a BB. I'm going to try mixing it directly with my mineral sunscreen when I apply it, to see if I can sheer it out a bit. If I'm completely wrong and it turns out to be amazing, I will update my review.

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2024
content:
I‚Äôm 37 and I‚Äôve never been a big full coverage girlie. I‚Äôve always preferred a more sheer coverage with glow. I usually achieve this by adding a moisturizer with SPF to a foundation because I‚Äôve never found a BB cream or anything that has the coverage, shade, texture and SPF that I prefer. Until this. I have light skin, pink/cool undertones with a lot of redness. The color 15 Rose Ivory has been the best color match I‚Äôve ever gotten maybe ever. It doesn‚Äôt try and just cover up my pink undertones. It covers the red without looking fake over the natural color of my skin. The coverage is SURPRISING for something that isn‚Äôt a full coverage foundation. I only needed a small amount and it covered my face. I use it with a glow primer to give it a little more moisture and slip on my skin as my skin is dry but also super breakout prone. I adore this stuff and I‚Äôm so mad it took me this long to try it. It feels calming and it washes off easily with a double cleanse. It doesn‚Äôt look cakey at all on me it looks super natural. I am so glad I tried this. I realize everyone‚Äôs foundation and skin needs are wildly different but for me this is perfection.
If you find it drying at all try with a glow moistening primer and a mist/spray like Glow Recipe, Farsali Tose gold mist or Pixi Glow Mist. All of those helped to give it that little bit of hydration my skin needs. I imagine for anyone with oily skin this would be a dream.
I couldn‚Äôt be happier with this. The color match alone, but the add the coverage and texture is just everything I wanted. I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôll be wearing anything else daily.

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2024
content: This product must have some magic in it. I buy #21 and it looks so grey and weird going on, but it blends so gorgeously into my fair skin. I‚Äôve gotten multiple compliments while wearing this that I am glowing. Such a nice, lightweight foundation. Shade selection is bad, but if you can find something sort of close to your color, give it a try and see if it‚Äôs magic for you too. I‚Äôm on my third tube!

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2023
content:
The video shows it all because clearly I didn‚Äôt care about posting a half-asleep test of the BB cream for all of the internet to see.

I have pale neutral skin with rosacea which makes foundation/BB cream shade selection impossible. I used Dr. Jart Black Label Detox Beauty Balm for years and was devastated by it getting discontinued, and have spent hundreds searching for a replacement. I am allergic to phenoxyethanol, which has replaced preservatives in most beauty products after the ‚Äúparaben-free‚Äù movement which left me with little to no choices. I am over the moon excited about this product and will be using this BB cream as long as it is not discontinued!

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2022
content:
In the summer, my skin is extremely oily, and most foundations I've used causes me to break out. My skin loves the ingredient, centella asiatica, and ever since using this product, the pimples have subsided on my face.

This product has a grayish tone when applied at first. Then after a few minutes, it starts to mesh with my skin tone. It has medium coverage, very blendable, and gives enough hydration without being overly oily on my face. The finish gives a natural satin on my face, not very dewy. Unfortunately, I still need to powder my face to control the oils if I plan to wear it 5+ hours.

Overall, I would recommend this product for normal to oily skin and for someone who likes a more natural finish.

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted

Is that I am naturally cool toned (pink under tones) this is a very warm toon product. I could make it work but it left my face with a slight yellow hue. For the price and quality it‚Äôs an excellent product.

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024

What a great lineup of products for reactive, sensitive and rosacea prone skin.

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2022
content: I stumbled upon this foundation from YouTuber Taylor Wynn. I wanted to leave a review to help anyone else struggling to find a beautiful foundation that doesn‚Äôt make their skin look worse. title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2023
content: I decided to try a few BB creams and tinted moisturizers after several years of using Bare Minerals Complexion Rescue and wondering if there was something better. Like many reviewers I found #21 to be perfection for my fair skin, which is slightly cool. It's rare for me to find such an exact match and not be between shades or a bit off on undertone. I set it with a dusting of Mineral Veil and it lasts all day. The finish is satin--not shiny, not matte. It's my new daily moisturizer and I'm so pleased.

title: PURITO Cica Clearing BB Cream #21 Light Beige 1 fl.oz / 30ml, Vegan bb cream, tinted

I use #21 Light Beige since I have very fair skin.

title: PURITO Pure Vitamin C Serum 60ml / 2.0 fl.oz., Natural Ingredients Serum, Vitamin C, Vegan & Cruelty Free, Hypoallergenic, Calming, Fragrance-free, Korean Skin Care
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2021
content: I have been using this Vit C serum for over a month now. It arrived fully sealed which is always reassuring. It also arrived with a clear color to it which is a good indication for Vit C serums and to my surprise it has remained clear now after a month of use indicating that the product is not oxidizing as time goes on. It does have a slight smell to it reflecting the ingredients of the product and yes it does smell faintly like hot dogs or metal as someone else pointed out but the smell quickly fades, no issue after a few moments and I have a nose that's easily irritated by scents. For my sensitive skin it is nice using a lower percentage of Vit C while still getting the benefit of pure Ascorbic Acid rather than a derivative. The serum has a fairly light consistency and it soaks in quickly, I have never had an issue with pilling. Also good value for money as it is 2oz. So far I have liked everything I have tried from this brand, though I have no interest in ever trying their sunscreens which come up short when under review, but all of the serums and moisturizers and cleansing oil have been great from this brand (and I really appreciate that every one of their products comes sealed, much more hygienic, sanitary and safe to be able to peel of the seal yourself)

title: PURITO Oat-in Calming Gel Cream 100 ml / 3.38 fl. oz. vegan, facial cream, moisture cream for face, natural ingredients
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2024
content:
So I have VERY sensative combination skin, and I am VERY fungal acne prone, so naturally finding a good moisturizer has been a struggle.

But THIS STUFF IS MY HOLY GRAIL!! It's super lightweight enough to not be oily or sticky, but still plenty moisturizing! I occasionally have to apply two applications, but only when my face is particularly dry after using exfoliaters.

It's fragrance free and has a very mild neutral scent that you'd expect from a fragrance free product.

It absorbs moderately fast and doesn't leave any stickiness, and leaves my face feeling soft and smooth, it pairs perfectly with my salicylic acid cleanser and niacinamide serum! This is the ONLY gel-cream moisturizer I've been able to use without fungal acne breakouts and I seriously recommend it ü•πüôè

title: PURITO Oat-in Calming Gel Cream 100 ml / 3.38 fl. oz. vegan, facial cream, moisture cream for face, natural ingredients
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2024
content:
If I could give it 10 stars, I would.
This is a lightweight moisturizer that has a very gel like texture. Both times I have used this, I put it on over night. I woke up both times with smooth, hydrated skin that had a healthy glow. Im a 10/10 with sensitivity and my skin reacts easily and thus far this has not caused any irritation, bumps, redness, itchy skin or acne. I haven't used this during the day time as I am using the Purito's SPF for daytime. I recommend this for sensitive or reactive skin that needs some hydration!
side note: I saw someone complaining about smell. This product has zero smell.
and: The ingredients in this are near perfect, as far as being both gentle and beneficial, non-comedogenic, non-acneic, soothing, moisturizing, brightening, non-iritating, silicone free, oil free, alcohol free, fragrance free, sulfate free, paraben free etc.

Update: After using this for about 2 months, I am HUGE FAN. I use this in the daytime now and it leaves such a healthy glow on my skin. I have never had any reaction to this moisturizer. My skin seems to be healing over time to the point that people have commented. This product does its job and does it well. I think this is what people call the Holy Grail when they find it. SO, this is my Holy Grail in the lightweight moisturizer category! I certainly hope Purito doesnt mess with this formulation.

title: PURITO Oat-in Calming Gel Cream 100 ml / 3.38 fl. oz. vegan, facial cream, moisture cream for face, natural ingredients
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2023
content:
Edit: okay, so I figured out a system that works best for me since my skin is dry and irritated from retinol and vitamin C. This feels heavenly and soothing. I start with a couple layers of essence. My favorite is Purito CIca. Serum. Oat gel. Dry and irritated spots get treated with a bit of CIca Recovery Cream.

I have been using this product for a few months now. I purchased this after I saw one of the Welsh Twins review it on his YouTube channel. This skinfluencer just couldn't say enough good things about it. He has oily skin, though, and said he applies a moisturizer over it. I have combination skin and didn't find it to be very hydrating or moisturizing. Nevertheless, I think someone with oily skin would like this if they lived in a hot or humid environment.

It has a very faint pleasant smell, slightly reminiscent of vanilla. The consistency is medium thickness, but it's not greasy. It doesn't feel heavy at all. It absorbs into the skin quickly. This is a quality product, buy I don't think I will repurchase.

I personally like the Centella Unscented Recovery Cream better. It's my Holy Grail, and I have purchased it many times. It's allegedly a dupe for a certain tiger balm by a certain Dr. J. I find it to be much more soothing for my sensitive skin and weak skin barrier. It's slightly more hydrating than the oat gel, though not by much. I like to layer the two if my skin is really irritated. Or I will apply retinol after the oat gel, and top off with the cream. Both products are good for people with acne. If you have dehydrated skin, I recommend applying 1-3 layers of the Centella Essence first. That's another Holy Grail of mine.
