title: PURITO Oat-in Calming Gel Cream 100 ml / 3.38 fl. oz. vegan, facial cream, moisture cream for face, natural ingredients
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2021
content:
In terms of ingredients, this gel cream is 10/10 for me *chef kiss*. I've finally found a gel cream that is not silicone- or dimethicone-based since silicone never agrees with my skin and tends to clog my pores, although for many silicone is good for locking in moisture. This gel cream has squalane instead to help with moisturizing, and I really love squalane. I use squalane oil in the winter to help with water loss and dry skin, and squalane never breaks me out. It is surprisingy lightweight and absorbs quickly.

In terms of its claim of soothing effects, this gel cream also contains oat seed water, panthenol, and the salt form of licorice root extract, which together help calm down my skin and soothe minor eczema patches on my cheek in a few days. Since it is not moisturizing enough in winter time, I use it as a serum and layer moisturizer and squalane oil on top, and wake up to soft and silky skin! Last but not least, this gel cream does not contain any ingredient that can trigger fungal ance, which is super awesome since I am also very prone to fungal acne.

Will definitely repurchase and stock up! Thank you Purito for such a wonderful product!!!

title: PURITO Oat-in Calming Gel Cream 100 ml / 3.38 fl. oz. vegan, facial cream, moisture cream for face, natural ingredients
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2024
content:
I was desperate to make this product work, since it is fungal Acne safe. But as a person who stopped slugging and using moisturizes like cetaphil for some time now, this just wasn‚Äôt cutting it. I have been suffering with fungal acne, and two months ago I started my journey with trying out new moisturizers that were fungal acne safe.

This was one of them, but it semi destroyed my skin barrier with how drying it was. If you have oily skin this would be PERFECT. But if you‚Äôre someone who has VERY dry skin, this probably won‚Äôt work for you.

There is no scent to it, and it absorbs almost immediately leaving no oily residue. It‚Äôs very thin like, nothing compared to what I was used to using. I even tried using it with the ‚Äúordinary 100% plant squalene‚Äù, it helped a LITTLE but the stinging was still there. No matter HOW MUCH I squeezed out, it was just never enough. My skin felt consistently tight and dehydrated with this.

I will say, that you receive a good amount for what you payfor. It can easily last 2/3 months.

Since embarking on this journey, I‚Äôve realized what might work for a majority of people might not actually work for you, even though the diagnosis might be the same. (Fungal acne)

So here‚Äôs what actually DID work for me, just in case anyone else may be struggling with the same. ‚ÄúCurell Japanese moisturizer and the Eucerin Orginal healing cream‚Äù. Give it a few days to repair your skin barrier, so SO worth it.

title: PURITO Oat-in Calming Gel Cream 100 ml / 3.38 fl. oz. vegan, facial cream, moisture cream for face, natural ingredients
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2022
content:
I was really hoping I'd be the outlier here, considering the great luck I've had with Purito before, but unfortunately I cannot say that this is a preferred product of mine.

The ingredients are great, but it lacks an occlusive that would make those ingredients STAY on your skin and do what they need to do. If this had dimethicone somewhere, it'd probably be perfect.

If you have oily skin that needs no real moisture, or live in a humid area, this is likely for you!

If you already have a good moisturizer and want a little something more that won't break you out, this is a good option!

If you do need moisture, however, this will not give you that. It completely evaporates from my skin after a few minutes and leaves it tighter and dryer than if I had just used nothing at all. Squalane is an oil, but it's not an occlusive oil, meaning that it won't form a layer to protect your skin and keep the water in. Mostly, it's great at tricking your skin into thinking you have enough squalene (a trick which reduces inflammation and oil production) and enhances the penetration of other ingredients. If you live somewhere that the air around you is always humid, then you may fare well with this, because it could draw moisture from the air into your skin. If you have air-conditioning or live somewhere dry, however, I cannot recommend this. It will strip your skin of its moisture and deposit it into the dryer air around you, thus doing the opposite of its proposed function, because it lacks an ingredient in its formulation that would prevent this.

This is fungal acne safe, not pore-clogging, and not irritating whatsoever. There are VERY FEW products in the WORLDWIDE market that can say that. This has clearly been formulated with care in mind and it does not contain needless fillers that hurt your skin or whose only purpose is to make this product more appealing. I wish there were more products like this.

Seeing as this has squalane and other great ingredients, I intend to use it as a layering step should my skin need some extra moisture after a chemical peel, acids, or other harsh actives, but I will not be using it as a STANDALONE moisturizer.

I'd say it's great for layering, as one would with a serum, but I wouldn't recommend it be used alone unless your skin doesn't need much added moisture.

I hope they keep this product, but add a gentle occlusive like dimethicone (or something similar) so that it can protect and smooth the skin and keep its acne safe claims.

Overall, it's not bad; it just needs to be used with something else, too, if it's to be used as a moisturizing product.

date: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2022
content: I use this as a body wash. The first time I used this soap I was disappointed because it felt like it left a residue. It felt like it was cleaning my skin though, and it wasn't a soapy/sticky/oily/tightening kind of residue. Plus I'd paid for it so I planned to just use it up. After using it 1 or 2 more times I noticed my skin was moisturized & staying supple and comfortable for like 24 to 36 hours after using this soap in my normal routine, where I would have started feeling dry w/in 10 or 12 hours before this soap. My normal routine is wash with soap, use witch hazel as a toner, then a thin layer of coconut oil & then pat my skin dry, so I don't use the soap alone, but having only switched the soap out (replaced Dr Bs castile bar w/this) my skin is staying comfortable and velvety for twice as long. That residue in the shower disappers when I dry off, too. Only soft skin stays. I love this stuff. Will definitely buy more.

title: PURITO From Green Cleansing Oil Original, 6.76 fl.oz / 200ml, Gentle Cleansing Oil for Face, Cruelty-free & Vegan, Korean Skin Care
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2024
content:
I really like this oil cleanser and the fact i don‚Äôt have to buy a completely new bottle when i run out. I‚Äôve had it for a handful of months now and i‚Äôm less than haft way through! I‚Äôve definitely noticed my skin looks more vibrant and it‚Äôs definitely getting cleaned when i double cleanse. When i stop using this when i‚Äôm not wearing makeup for a while i notice my basic foam cleanser doesn‚Äôt do as good a job taking my days grim and sunscreen off.
You may think that you don‚Äôt need an oil cleanser cause your skin is super oily or acne prone but it‚Äôs a must if you wear makeup. It takes all your makeup and sunscreen off. But you MUST follow up with another cleaner (like a foaming one is great) cause this is still oil.
so step by step:
1) pump once into you hands (you can always add more)
2) rub into your face (anywhere you have makeup especially) for about 30sec it doesn‚Äôt take long
3) wet your hands and rub your wet hands into your skin for like 10 second (it should become milky looking) now you can either give it a quick rinse or move onto step 4
4) take your basic cleanser (foam works great) and emulsify that with some water and rub into your face. Especially with a foam cleanser your gonna get all the remaining oil and grim off you face
5) rinse and apply whatever you normally do after washing your face (toner/moisturizer)

title: PURITO From Green Cleansing Oil Original, 6.76 fl.oz / 200ml, Gentle Cleansing Oil for Face, Cruelty-free & Vegan, Korean Skin Care
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2022
content: I have used a couple of different balms and oils now. I think this one is my favorite in terms of the packaging. I like the pump. I also really like that it goes on as an oil and then with water it washes off and doesn't leave an oily residue. You do have to spend quite a bit of time massaging it in though to get eye makeup off. I use a face wash afterwards (vanicream) but sometimes even after the two-step cleaning process, I still need to go in with a little bit of micellar water to get off all the eye make-up. The Inkey Lists Oat Cleansing Balm might do a better job of removing eye makeup but it irritates my eyes more than this one. The Then I Met You Cleansing balm has done the best job in removing eye makeup for me, I think, but I don't care for the scent or the price point. I've also used various other oils (e.g. coconut, olive, apricot, jojoba) and I don't like the oily residue they leave behind but they are probably the best at completely removing my eye makeup. In summary, I really do like this so unless I find something better and that's reasonably priced, I think this will be my go-to for now.

title: PURITO Oat-in Silky Toner 200ml / 6.76 fl. oz. Vegan Ingredients, Cruelty-Free, Facial Toner
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2023
content:
Play Video
This is an awesome, bare-bones toner. I like having something simple I can pair with my tretinoin + benzoyl peroxide daily acne routine without worry. No niacinamide, hyaluronic acid, fragrance or other irritators. I‚Äôve started applying two layers instead of one, and it gives me a beautifullll glass skin finish. I put on the two layers at night and my skin looks gorgeous in the morning. The scent is lovely too, a very natural, subtle oat smell.

Update: I‚Äôve started using this all over my body before my thick night cream, and it‚Äôs amazing. It‚Äôs cleared some keratosis pilaris on my bottom, and since using it daily on my armpits, they look lighter. There‚Äôs no lightening ingredients in it. I think it‚Äôs just like Dr. Dray explains: very hydrated skin has better cell regeneration and will naturally exfoliate/ shed/ renew itself better. Lots of us are taught not to moisturize our armpits. A lotion/ cream could block deodorant too much, understandable, but a moisturizing toner doesn‚Äôt in my experience.

This makes my body cream work better. My skin looks and feels thoroughly moisturized and dewy whereas before it was a little dry. It‚Äôs too expensive to use all over my body though. I went through the bottle quickly. But this is still my holy grail for my face. I wish there were more value-size, milky, simple toners that I could use on my body, like the TonyMoly ceramide toner. I don‚Äôt like that that one has fragrance though.

Other Update: I tried the I‚Äôm From rice toner recently. Not bad, but I like this oat toner more. More moisturizing, without being too rich (I have oily-normal skin). I need 3 layers of rice toner to do what 2 layers of this oat toner does. And the rice toner stings.

title: PURITO Oat-in Silky Toner 200ml / 6.76 fl. oz. Vegan Ingredients, Cruelty-Free, Facial Toner
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2023
content:
This is an above average toner for sensitive skin. Is it the best toner? No. Personally, I like the Purito Green Centella Asiatica toner the best. The next best would be the unscented centella asiatica serum.

This is a nice basic, all-natural toner. I purchased it because my skin barrier is compromised and I have very sensitive skin. Beta glucan is derived from oats and is great for repairing the skin.
This toner is best used in a spray bottle. I tried to apply it directly with my hand, let it absorb, and apply another layer. This was a big mistake, as it left a thin film on my skin. Use this sparingly. A little goes a long way.

This is a very simple recipe that is very close to something that could be made at home -- except it has a longer shelf life. You don't have to worry about it growing bacteria or fungus after a few days.

content: I really like Purito and was excited to try this toner. I usually use a hyaluronic acid toner and replaced it with this toner. There was a very faint scent that didn‚Äôt bother me at all. title: PURITO Oat-in Silky Toner 200ml / 6.76 fl. oz. Vegan Ingredients, Cruelty-Free, Facial Toner
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2023
content:
Using this Purito Oat-In Silky Toner was quite the experience. This toner is stripped down to minimal ingredients, branding, and packaging - no frills here! The toner comes in a clear bottle and looks just like milk. It has a thinner consistency than I expected, and has no noticeable scent. Because it is thin, it isn‚Äôt the easiest toner to spread, and I find myself having to apply more toner to my cotton round to cover my entire face, which is why I took off one star from my rating. However, if you don‚Äôt like the look & feel of a heavy toner on your face, this toner will be perfect for you.

The toner literally only has 10 ingredients in it - that is really hard to find in skincare products nowadays! So if you are looking for a toner with minimal ingredients, then this one might be perfect for you! The active ingredient in this toner is Avena Sativa Kernel Extract, which is another name for oat extract. It is know for antioxidant and skin-soothing properties.

In all, this toner is just right for people with sensitive skin!

title: PURITO Oat-in Silky Toner 200ml / 6.76 fl. oz. Vegan Ingredients, Cruelty-Free, Facial Toner
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2023
content:
Play Video
Sustainable and clean beauty have become a new trend in the recent skincare product, and I think we are going into the right direction. Purito mentioned that they have removed unnecessary packaging, stickers and labels also used the recycled plastic for this product. It really came without box packaging, just with soy ink printed manual hanging on the neck of the product. I firmly believe it's praiseworthy direction for a skincare product. So here is what I think about this product.

Ingredients:
What I really like about this product is that it has very short ingredient list. There are millions of companies that adds negligible amount of the exotic extracts, which practically doesn't do anything and try to deceive customers by diluting the harmful ingredients presence in the list. This company doesn't It's based with oat seed water, and quite a bit of conditioning and hydrating ingredients like butylene glycol and beta glucan. It used polyglycerl10 stearate as surfactant/stabilizer, which is considered safe on skin. It used 1,2 hexanediol as preservative / solvent, so practically there is a zero harmful ingredients. It's one of the cleanest beauty product that I have reviewed.

Texture:
As you can see, it has milky color and very watery texture. It practically has no viscosity. Due to the high concentration of oat seed water, it makes skin somehow powdery / silky. It's not sticky and absorbed to the skin very quickly. It CAN be used as wipe off type or tapping type both.

Effectiveness:
To be honest, I am not sure this is deeply hydrating but at least, it leaves skin very silky. I generally use serum and moisturizer afterwards, so it's good enough, but if you are the toner only person, then you may feel this is drying. Definitely, it's very gentle and highly unlikely will make you irritated unless you don't have allergies with oat.

Scent:
It's FRAGRANCE FREE product, and due to the high oat seed water contents, it practically smells like diluted oat milk. It's pretty soothing and nice.

Buy this if you need: a gentle toner for your skincare routine that makes your skin very silky.
Don't if you : are looking for all-in-on hydrating type toner. It's not hydrating enough.

title: PURITO Oat-in Silky Toner 200ml / 6.76 fl. oz. Vegan Ingredients, Cruelty-Free, Facial Toner
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2023
content: I'm sort of obsessed with this now. The relatively minimal ingredients list has everything I want (hydration, soothing, light moisturization) and nothing I don't (more niacinamide, hyaluronic acid, multiple plant extracts, et al). It leaves a terrific glow, helps subsequent products absorb better, and forms a light shield against the environment. It does have a subtle scent (naturally from the oat), but it doesn't linger and is pleasant. I use two layers twice a day and the bottle is still going to last me months. I had been using rice toners (which I love) but all the brands I like use niacinamide and I have more than enough of that in my routine already and was trying to pare back. It excels at being an oat toner instead of trying to be every product in one. That's exactly what I wanted.

This is a nice size bottle and is a great buy.

title: PURITO Oat-in Silky Toner 200ml / 6.76 fl. oz. Vegan Ingredients, Cruelty-Free, Facial Toner
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2023
content:
TLDR: legit perfect toner for ALL skin types. Honestly just get this toner, you won‚Äôt regret it.

I already left a glowing review on the matching oat moisturizer from this line so I thought I would briefly rave about this toner. I‚Äôm a big toner gal, I think they‚Äôre so underrated in skincare routines, and it‚Äôs toners like this that I would use as an example of all the added benefits of using a toner. It‚Äôs soothing, it‚Äôs hydrating, it‚Äôs glowy, it gives radiant, glass skin. Especially paired with the moisturizer, I‚Äôve noticed my skin is so much less irritated and red, it‚Äôs soooo much more hydrated and I feel like my skin barrier is stronger too (let me mention I‚Äôve been using this for about two weeks, maybe less). It has the slightest oat smell but I think it just adds to the ~experience~, and the texture is so milky. I‚Äôve never used a toner with this thin of a consistency and I was actually really skeptical about this one providing enough hydration as I have extremely dry and dehydrated skin, but my skin drinks it right up in a way that I don‚Äôt even need to use a serum or anything else before the moisturizer. My routine is now cut down to literally three steps and with much simpler ingredients, yet it has legitimately never looked better.

title: PURITO Oat-in Silky Toner 200ml / 6.76 fl. oz. Vegan Ingredients, Cruelty-Free, Facial Toner

I have eczema and tend to get it around my eyes and nose. I haven‚Äôt had any flare ups since using this and my skin is noticbly less red with a more even tone.

I also love that it gives me the same sort of bouncy, dewy glow. I layer up depending on how my skin is feeling. If it‚Äôs feeling dry and irritated, I use up to 5 layers at night. In the morning, I use 1 or 2 layers and my makeup sits well on top of this (plus my other skincare products).

I would highly recommend to anyone looking for something that is soothing, adds hydration, and gives a slight dew.

title: PURITO Oat-in Intense Cream 150ml / 5.07 fl. oz, Vegan Ingredients, Cruelty-Free, Facial cream
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
content:
That is, for a Korean moisturizer. I have combination skin (oily t-zone/dry everywhere else) with red, acne-prone skin. I love oats in skincare and my first product I loved with it is Aveeno‚Äôs eczema cream. It is great for irritated and dry skin. However I could only use it at night time since it is a thicker formula. This however is beautiful for daytime under sunscreen & makeup! I just give it a few minutes to absorb and it plays well. I recently had this patch of redness, bumps, and peeling, flaky skin around my nose. This slowed down the flaking and soothed the tight, dry skin. I also ended used this when I got hit with fever. You know how irritated and flaky your nose feels after 1-2 days of frequent nose blowing.. well I applied this like crazy and as a pleasant surprise I had no peeling, flaky nostrils afterwards. Also that dime sized red, flake patch with bumps? It‚Äôs gone now and I attribute this product had a large part in its disappearance.

Moving onto ingredients. It‚Äôs only 15 ingredients, the same as the Aveeno product I mentioned earlier. However, the percentage of oat ingredients is higher in Purito‚Äôs product. About 72% of this product is made up of oat while in the Aveeno it‚Äôs a combined percentage of 1. I can definitely feel this calm my skin and help relieve dryness. The relief doesn‚Äôt last long on its own though. There is no well known occlusives in this. The only ingredient that would provide occlusive properties is the oat kernel oil. Depending how many products I use in my morning routine it may be 2 to 4 hours before I feel the need to reapply. I usually just add another light moisturizer on top my drier areas and I‚Äôll stay hydrated until night time. As for skin soothing this will calm any itchiness or dryness but on actual irritated skin it won‚Äôt right away. Applying it on my red patch it would sting momentarily when I applied this very gentle formula but it did not further irritate it. The smell of this is my favorite of all my skincare products which isn‚Äôt saying much because I go fragrance free lol. BUT it does smell like authentic oats that is slightly sweetened. Now THAT is immediately soothing and calming for me mentally. Overall if you suffer from dehydration/dryness and have very sensitive skin this will be a great emulsion to add under a thicker moisturizer.

title: PURITO Oat-in Intense Cream 150ml / 5.07 fl. oz, Vegan Ingredients, Cruelty-Free, Facial cream
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
content: I thought it would be a good replacement for the aveeno calm & restore which gets a little pricey, but it doesn‚Äôt have that silky feel. It‚Äôs not bad if you don‚Äôt get it near your eyes (it buuuurns)! First layer doesn‚Äôt seem moisturizing enough, but 2 leaves my face feeling pretty greasy? So it‚Äôs not a bad moisturizer, I just prefer the aveeno and that leaves my face silky soft.

title: PURITO Oat-in Intense Cream 150ml / 5.07 fl. oz, Vegan Ingredients, Cruelty-Free, Facial cream
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2023
content:
TLDR: fantastic moisturizer, one of my best purchases of 2023 by far, if not THE best one. Get this moisturizer, period, no hesitation.

I have exceptionally dry skin that gets flakey easily and it‚Äôs especially difficult to treat because it‚Äôs also acne-prone, so most ingredients in other moisturizers that are targeted towards really dry and dehydrated skin break me out. I‚Äôve been using this and the matching oat toner and let me tell you, my skin has never felt so soft and smooth and hydrated!! It‚Äôs so glowy and it‚Äôs a noticeable difference compared to before I started using it. At the time, my skin had dry patches AND active breakouts simultaneously and anything I used to try to remedy the problem just made it so much worse, so me and my skin were s t r u g g l i n g, let me tell ya. I cannot sing enough praise for this oat line. The consistency is wonderful, it‚Äôs thick enough to provide the hydration and nourishment my skin needs but it‚Äôs not so thick that it leaves a sticky residue or just sits on my skin‚Ä¶ it melts into my skin like butter and leaves the most beautiful naturally ‚Äúlit from within‚Äù dewy finish that most moisturizers tend to promise but fall flat on. There is almost no fragrance at all except a VERY slight oat smell (as to be expected) but it‚Äôs almost completely unnoticeable. If you look at the ingredients, the list is free from anything that could potentially clog your pores or irritate your skin in any manner. I also struggle with a lot of redness, I think related to rosacea, and I‚Äôve noticed that not only does it minimize redness because of how soothing it is, but for me personally it seems as though it prevents my skin from getting irritated to the point of redness. It‚Äôs also worth mentioning that I incorporate tretinoin into my routine as well, so my skin barrier is fragile and this moisturizer seems to have strengthened it substantially. I have searched high and low for my ‚Äúperfect moisturizer‚Äù that checks all my boxes and I‚Äôm delighted to say that I‚Äôve finally found it!! Sometimes simplicity is the best route to take.

title: PURITO Oat-in Intense Cream 150ml / 5.07 fl. oz, Vegan Ingredients, Cruelty-Free, Facial cream

Less red and a decrease in breakouts. I absolutely love this moisturizer. I wish they made a travel size too so I could keep in my purse!

title: PURITO Oat-in Intense Cream 150ml / 5.07 fl. oz, Vegan Ingredients, Cruelty-Free, Facial cream
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2023
content:
I was expecting a cream moisturizer for day time use based off the product listing and reviews, but this is more of a creamy emulsion. The texture looks and feel like a lightweight lotion. Once applied, it turns into a watery, creamy emulsion consistency, as it's mostly oat water about 71%. I layered this 2-3 times after a couple of layers of toners, but for my normal/dry skin, this is not moisturizing enough. This would be better for those who are looking for an oat based emulsion, or a very light weight lotion.

The ingredients are great, and the smell is very nice- a mild oat scent. However, I wish it had more moisturizing power.

Ingredients:
Avena Sativa (Oat) Seed Water (Skin-Conditioning Agent), Glycerin (Humectant), Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride (Skin-Conditioning Agent), Avena Sativa (Oat) Kernel Oil (Skin-Conditioning Agent), Butylene Glycol (Humectant), 1,2-Hexanediol (Solvent), Glyceryl Stearate (Surfactant), Polyglyceryl-2 Stearate (Surfactant), Water (Solvent), Stearyl Alcohol (Surfactant), Carbomer (Viscosity Increasing Agents), Arginine (Ph Adjuster), Ethylhexylglycerin (Skin-Conditioning Agent), Avena Sativa (Oat) Kernel Flour (Skin-Conditioning Agent), Avena Sativa (Oat) Kernel Extract (Skin-Conditioning Agent)

One thing that got me really really excited though‚Ä¶.was it didn‚Äôt has any silicone products in it which means some of my K Beauty sunscreens don‚Äôt pill at all with this moisturizer. This is a huge plus for me because I like my skin nice and hydrated and I can still apply K Beauty sunscreens that aren‚Äôt the most hydrating (not drying though) for my dry skin. I‚Äôve also used this multiple times on my hands for dryness and it makes a good hand cream and again, it pairs really well with K beauty physical/mineral sunscreens
Overall-I‚Äôm very glad I purchased it and when I run out I will probably repurchase if I don‚Äôt try any other moisturizers first. I even used this on my boyfriend and he liked it a lot! He has even more dry skin than me, but it was still hydrating enough for him.

title: PURITO Oat-in Intense Cream 150ml / 5.07 fl. oz, Vegan Ingredients, Cruelty-Free, Facial cream
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2023
content:
I initially bought this because I started my tretinoin prescription and it was drying me out completely w/ dry patches the next morning. I bought it some time after Purito released it last year on Amazon. When they refer to the product as an ‚Äòintense cream‚Äô they really mean it. The description says it‚Äôs a ‚Äòcream‚Äô but it has a lotion like texture. Other than the texture, this instantly soothes my irritated skin without burning and keeps me hydrated. After application and absorption my skin feels very soft and plum with no residue after. While leaving me feeling deeply moisturized throughout the night.

Overall I would definitely recommend this cream. My skin absolutely loves this and soaks it up every time. This is a good moisturizer if you are using tretinoin or a retinoid to help keep you moisturized without worrying about dry patches. If u have sensitive skin that reacts to anything this would be perfect. It only has 15 ingredients and a majority of them contain oats. It doesn‚Äôt include any essential oils or fragrances which is a plus. You get 5oz for 21.00 which is a affordable price point for a moisturizer that should last you for quite some time. They also released an oats toner so Im definitely gonna check that out.

title: PURITO Oat-in Intense Cream 150ml / 5.07 fl. oz, Vegan Ingredients, Cruelty-Free, Facial cream
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2023
content: I purchased this cream on February 8th and it has been amazing for my skin! I use on both my face and both legs where I was experiencing a pretty bad and long (over a year) psoriasis flare up. Between using this and aquaphor on my legs, my psoriasis flare has ended. Purito just sinks into my skin and eases all itching and flakiness and moisturizes my skin in a way no lotion or cream that I have ever used has before. It is pretty rare for a lotion or cream to not irritate the psoriasis patches at all so even though this is an expensive cream once I realized the effects on my skin I just had to use it all over. Even using this over a large portion of my body (some days all of it) it has lasted me over 2 months. My face only takes a small dot and my legs each take a pump. Once my skin is damp when I put it on, which it always is, this cream spreads really well and still sinks in beautifully with only a small amount. I have tried over 20 different moisturizers on my face and this has been the best ones so far. I can use it day or night although more sparingly during the day. It has completely healed my cheeks which have been dry and chapped looking for months when no other moisturizer, hyaluronic lotion or sheet mask has made a difference. Purito and aquaphor are my winning combination head to toe. I am impatiently awaiting the arrival of my next bottle. Please please please start selling this in a bigger size!

title: PURITO Oat-in Intense Cream 150ml / 5.07 fl. oz, Vegan Ingredients, Cruelty-Free, Facial cream
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2023
content:
This facial cream has quickly become a staple in my skincare routine due to its hydrating and vegan ingredients.

First and foremost, I appreciate that this cream is cruelty-free and made with vegan ingredients. As someone who values ethical and cruelty-free beauty products, this was a big selling point for me. It's great to know that I can enjoy a high-quality facial cream without compromising my values.

The texture of the cream is rich and creamy, and it applies smoothly on my skin. A little goes a long way, and it absorbs quickly without leaving any greasy residue. My skin feels instantly hydrated and nourished upon application.

I have noticed a significant improvement in the overall moisture level of my skin since incorporating this cream into my routine. My skin feels softer, smoother, and more plump, which is exactly what I look for in a hydrating cream. The oat-based ingredients provide a calming effect on my skin, leaving it feeling soothed and refreshed.

The packaging is sleek and hygienic, with a pump dispenser that allows for easy and controlled application. The scent of the cream is pleasant and not overpowering, which I appreciate as someone with sensitive skin.

The only reason I am giving this product a 4-star review instead of 5 is because of the price. While I find the performance of the cream to be excellent, it is on the higher end of the price range for facial creams. However, considering the quality of the ingredients and the results it delivers, I am willing to invest in this product. While it may be on the pricier side, the performance and ethical values of this cream make it a worthy investment for anyone seeking a hydrating cream with vegan ingredients.

title: PURITO Oat-in Intense Cream 150ml / 5.07 fl. oz, Vegan Ingredients, Cruelty-Free, Facial cream
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2023
content:
This facial cream has oatmeal as its basic and primary ingredient. One of the best-known benefits of oatmeal for skin is its ability to help hydrate and nourish dry skin. Skincare products containing oatmeal can help with hydrating skin, reducing skin dryness and associated symptoms such as itching, flaking, and tightness. This is especially true of colloidal oatmeal, which, when applied topically, forms an occlusive barrier on the skin, helping to prevent excessive water loss. Oatmeal also helps strengthen the skin's natural moisture barrier while keeping your skin well-hydrated and helps protect your skin‚Äôs natural moisture barrier.

This facial cream has a light creamy texture on it. It is easily absorb by the skin but leaves the skin a bit wet. It nevertheless leave the skin smooth and soft.
Worth a try!

title: PURITO Oat-in Intense Cream 150ml / 5.07 fl. oz, Vegan Ingredients, Cruelty-Free, Facial cream
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2023
content:
‚Ä¶but an amazing, calming moisturizer.

UPDATE: After further use and struggle with the pump, I decided to really think about why I wanted this moisturizer in the first place. Oats are so calming to the skin, but after surgery on my hand, I can‚Äôt use this bottle for a while. And, my skin hasn‚Äôt missed this product at all.

In the meantime I switched to a Beta-Glucan serum, but I think I‚Äôll permanently make the switch only due to the absolutely horrible pump of this Oat-In moisturizer. If you‚Äôre set on using this product as it‚Äôs the only oat-based moisturizer that doesn‚Äôt contain other known irritants, read on‚Ä¶

‚Äî‚Äî

ORIGINAL REVIEW:

I have Sahara-dry skin with rosacea, plus a mast-cell disorder which causes regular skin inflammation and severe flushing. With that, this gel-cream moisturizer is a fantastic addition to my routine!

With the crappy pump, I use 20-25 pumps (teeny, minuscule squirts‚Äîimagine a dropper bottle but only about an eighth of the product actually comes out of the full dropper. It‚Äôs *that* level of annoyance) to cover my face, neck, and upper chest.

I can see this being a great standalone moisturizer for someone with oily skin, but for someone with dry skin, expect to use it in addition to a heavier moisturizer to ensure proper skin barrier maintenance.

It‚Äôs a great, simple-ingredient, creamy, light moisturizer with wonderful calming benefits that anyone can use.

To note: I can‚Äôt consume oats (I‚Äôm also a Celiac, and the avenins in oats trigger an immune response in me similar to the way it responds to gluten), but I benefit greatly from topical application. As long as you don‚Äôt have a contact allergy, this seriously will work for anyone.

Hope this helps!

Oh, and the last matter: The bottle is designed to be easily recyclable with no label adhered to it. I love the design and concept! But it does arrive naked in an Amazon package‚Äîmeaning no recyclable box or anything protecting the bottle from germs.

This is my second purchase of this moisturizer, and I just wash the bottle in cold water with a mild soap so I don‚Äôt accidentally smear everything it‚Äôs come in contact with on my face‚Äînot a big deal. But what annoyed me was Amazon putting its product label sticker on the second bottle‚Ä¶. I can‚Äôt get that sucker off! The ink certainly got all over my hands while trying, though. So, I just cold-washed it like the previous bottle. The ink came right off, and I was able to peel about half the label off too. But Amazon putting a sticker on the bottle eliminates Purito‚Äôs packaging goal so‚Ä¶. Just thought I‚Äôd give you a head‚Äôs up.

title: PURITO Oat-in Intense Cream 150ml / 5.07 fl. oz, Vegan Ingredients, Cruelty-Free, Facial cream

title: PURITO Oat-in Intense Cream 150ml / 5.07 fl. oz, Vegan Ingredients, Cruelty-Free, Facial cream
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2023
content:
I have "normal" skin with some redness, that is prone to drying if I don't moisturize enough, and usually responds well to oat. I used Purito's Oat-In Gel Cream in the summer months as a last step, which has an extremely light watery texture. But for winter when the air is dryer, I wanted something more occlusive.

I first tried Krave's Oat So Simple, which I would describe as a "lightweight lotion." I really liked it and would use it again, but it still wasn't quite heavy enough for winter for me. When applied at night, I would wake up with my face completely dry.

So now I've decided to try Purito's Oat-in Intense Cream. It was lighter than I expected it to be - I would describe this as a "light lotion" too, but it is a tad more occlusive than the Krave due to the addition of oat kernel oil, which keeps it from completely absorbing/drying down (ideal for winter). It's definitely not anywhere near a heavy night cream, but layered over a toner, active, and serum, it's been working well for me in winter. It probably wouldn't be enough on its own, especially if you have dry skin. I'll probably pair it with Purito's sleeping pack a few times a week for an added moisture boost.

It hasn't broken me out, and I love that it's fragrance-free with a fairly simple ingredient list (it only smells like oatmeal when you first apply it, which I find pleasant).

I also really like that it didn't come in a box or other unnecessary packaging, and that the label is embossed right into the bottle. It did come with a little cap over the pump which will be nice for travel so it doesn't accidentally dispense in my bag. Other brands could take note on that!

Overall, I'll definitely finish up this bottle but might look for something a bit more heavy next winter season instead.

title: PURITO Oat-in Intense Cream 150ml / 5.07 fl. oz, Vegan Ingredients, Cruelty-Free, Facial cream

title: PURITO Oat-in Intense Cream 150ml / 5.07 fl. oz, Vegan Ingredients, Cruelty-Free, Facial cream

content: My skin is extremely dry and seems unaffected by most so-called intense moisturizers, so this one did come as a mostly pleasant surprise. Not quite my holy grail though since it does leave a sort of tacky, shiny film that I don't really like. It's not greasy feeling and not sticky, just tacky and shiny. Good for use at night, but I wouldn't want to use it during the day if I was going to be seen by anyone because of that shine. It didn't improve the natural redness my skin is prone to at all, but it didn't make it any worse either. For me the main thing is really the moisture and this actually does work for that. My skin is usually painfully dry and flaky, especially in winter when the windows are closed and the heat is on, and this was good enough to last through the night without me waking up feeling dry and flaky again. It's a really nice, big bottle too, and it doesn't take much at all, so I expect the bottle will last quite awhile. Certainly long enough to get your money's worth. Great for nighttime use.

title: PURITO Oat-in Intense Cream 150ml / 5.07 fl. oz, Vegan Ingredients, Cruelty-Free, Facial cream
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2024
content: I initially bought this moisturizer about 6 months ago and loved it. Recently, I decided to switch to a drugstore brand since it was the same brand as my face wash (big mistake). Even though both moisturizers are about the same price, I immediately started breaking out and my skin was noticeably drier after using the drugstore brand. Moral of the story: this moisturizer is truly hydrating and my breakouts have significantly decreased since switching back. For the price and ingredients it‚Äôs unbeatable. I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôll ever use another moisturizer.

title: PURITO Oat-in Intense Cream 150ml / 5.07 fl. oz, Vegan Ingredients, Cruelty-Free, Facial cream
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2023
content:
This does keep my skin feeling more fresh and moistened, though it can also leave it feeling a little sticky. There's no bothersome smell or anything like that.

The package for it is a bit strange - it's a bottle with a little paper thing hung over the neck of it. To read the ingredients and such, you'd probably have to tear it off, because a bunch of the information is on the inside of the folded paper. I think the packaging should be fixed, because if someone needs to check for ingredients they might be allergic to, they'd pretty much have to take off the label to do it, or hold it open and try to uncomfortably read it.

It pumps out in a tiny little stream but you don't need too much to spread it on your face, and it spreads pretty easily.

I think, overall, it works out fine for a facial cream.

title: PURITO Oat-in Intense Cream 150ml / 5.07 fl. oz, Vegan Ingredients, Cruelty-Free, Facial cream

title: PURITO Oat-in Intense Cream 150ml / 5.07 fl. oz, Vegan Ingredients, Cruelty-Free, Facial cream

title: PURITO Oat-in Intense Cream 150ml / 5.07 fl. oz, Vegan Ingredients, Cruelty-Free, Facial cream
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2023
content: This oat cream is made in Korea. It comes in a plastic bottle with a pump and does take quite a few pumps on first use to come out. The cream has a nice fragrance of oats to it that is not overwhelming. It absorbs well into skin and is not irritating. I found this to be pretty moisturizing without leaving my skin greasy or sticky. It also did not make my acne worse.

title: PURITO Oat-in Intense Cream 150ml / 5.07 fl. oz, Vegan Ingredients, Cruelty-Free, Facial cream
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2023
content:
Very surprised with how lightweight this lotion feels! I'm a huge fan of oat creams, they have consistently been awesome for my dry skin but typically they are a bit thicker than this and more suitable for night use. This lotion, however, feels more like a water gel and sinks in like a dream! Still get that lovely moisturizing ability but more suited for day use. It does smell like oats, but not overwhelming at all.
Also, the packaging is genius! I was worried about how it wasn't going to come in a box. But they took care of all my doubts by adding this plastic cap around the nozzle, it's so easy to take on and off and keeps the packaging from spilling.

title: PURITO Oat-in Intense Cream 150ml / 5.07 fl. oz, Vegan Ingredients, Cruelty-Free, Facial cream
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2023
content:
This is a light, delicate cream that absorbs quickly into the skin and leaves a soft, non oily finish.

I love that it's heavy on oats, which are really soothing for all kind of skin irritations. (if you have an oat allergy, beware, though!)

I'll be using this both for myself, and my kiddo, who suffers from some eczema in the wintertime. It's a lot lighter than a lot of creams I've gotten for that.

There is barely any scent to the cream at all, which is great - I'm always happy to see a company investing their energy into the effectiveness of a product rather than the peripheral stuff like scent and color.

It's not cheap, but the size of the bottle makes it quite a good deal. Thumbs up!

title: PURITO Oat-in Intense Cream 150ml / 5.07 fl. oz, Vegan Ingredients, Cruelty-Free, Facial cream
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2023
content: I have acne prone, combination (but mostly oily) skin. Due to some acne treatments, my skin was very sensitive (even to my snail cream) and drying out in some areas. I bought this cream on a whim, but I'm glad I did! The texture is quite nice and smooth, and it really has almost no scent - only a slight, oatmeal smell but literally only for a few seconds when you rub the cream in the area below your nose. If you have an OILY t-zone (like I do) a pump or two is sufficient...if you use more than that your face is going to look like an oil spill in the morning! It's soothing, especially if your skin is going through weak skin barrier issues that makes it sting with other face products - this cream doesn't exacerbate any redness or stinging. The only thing is that it gave me a few white heads in my chin area where I get acne, but it wasn't a huge deal and they went away after a few uses, it never actually broke me out or made my active acne worse. I reccomend this moisturizer! Also, it's quite a lot of product for the price - you use very little per application so I'm guessing I'll be using this bottle for over 6 months which is nice :)

title: PURITO Oat-in Intense Cream 150ml / 5.07 fl. oz, Vegan Ingredients, Cruelty-Free, Facial cream
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2023
content: I really liked the weight of this moisturizer and the pleasing and almost neutral oat scent. One thing that was slightly annoying was there are absolutely zero English instructions or ingredients on the bottle itself. Overall good but would have been great with more info/packaging

title: PURITO Oat-in Intense Cream 150ml / 5.07 fl. oz, Vegan Ingredients, Cruelty-Free, Facial cream

My skin is not super dry so this cream hydrating pretty well. Doesn't irritate my skin and I think good for sensitive skin.

title: PURITO Oat-in Intense Cream 150ml / 5.07 fl. oz, Vegan Ingredients, Cruelty-Free, Facial cream
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2024
content:
I wanted to try this after using the gel version which I loved. This cream is non-sticky, high quality, lightweight but luxurious. Smells lightly of oats but I don't fint it bothersome. Great for skin with barrier damage and for those using exfoliants/retinoids. I actually prefer this thicker formula over the gel, but they are both excellent.

I really dislike the pump. It took A LOT of work to get the lotion to dispense from the pump the first time and it seems to resist traveling through the tiny tube attached to the nozzle. Otherwise, I do like the glass bottle and the cap the comes on the pump.

Would definitely recommend and repurchase (in spite of the aggravating pump).

title: PURITO Oat-in Intense Cream 150ml / 5.07 fl. oz, Vegan Ingredients, Cruelty-Free, Facial cream
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2023
content:
You guys are gems for putting the percentage in for each oat byproduct in the ingredients list! I was worried because I've once used an oat moisturizer from another brand and my face became red and itchy until I removed it. This did not do that and it's very soothing on my skin.

The pump's a little wonky as it only dispenses a little for some reason, but I don't mind.

I use this right after toning or after a shower. It leaves my skin feeling moisturized and there is almost a little bit of a tacky feel. I use it in the morning before sunscreen as well and have had no issues with pilling.

I'd recommend this for drier skin, it even says on the bottle that it "replenishes oil and moisture balance". As always, test it before slathering it on.

title: PURITO Oat-in Intense Cream 150ml / 5.07 fl. oz, Vegan Ingredients, Cruelty-Free, Facial cream

title: PURITO Oat-in Intense Cream 150ml / 5.07 fl. oz, Vegan Ingredients, Cruelty-Free, Facial cream
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2023
content:
I was looking for a moisturizer since the one I was using was breaking me out, and saw that this one was recently released. So far I've been using it for two weeks and I think I've found my new holy grail! First off, the value is incredible - over 5 ounces for $21 is unheard of. Second it's very well formulated and perfect for sensitive skin.
The name is "intense cream" but it's actually very lightweight, almost like a gel cream. It sinks right into skin and feels moisturizing without leaving a heavy film. I thought it wouldn't be enough at first I can leave this alone as my last step and still wake up without flaky, dry skin in the morning. It has a light scent like oatmeal that's actually pretty pleasant. Best of all, it doesn't irritate my eczema prone skin at all, it's actually very soothing (I think it's the oats)!
Between this and the other products I've purchased recently, Purito has definitely redeemed themselves for me since the sunscreen controversy a few years ago. I will definitely continue to purchase from them and I'm excited to try other products as well!

title: PURITO Oat-in Intense Cream 150ml / 5.07 fl. oz, Vegan Ingredients, Cruelty-Free, Facial cream
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2022
content:
My skin type: dry and dehydrated. Acne prone. Daily Tretinoin use.
I got this a few days ago and am very pleased with it so far. It replaced my Pyunkang yul ato cream blue label in the tube. The packaging is very sleek hard plastic and the wording is imprinted on the outside-they say this is to make it easier to recycle and save from extra plastic labeling. I have also used the gel cream and this is really night and day and not comparable at all imo. It comes in a pump bottle and pumps about a pea size each. I use 2 pumps for my whole face and neck. I struggle with very dry skin that is dry in the morning if I don‚Äôt use a very thick moisturizer at night. This keeps my face dewy and moist all night. It‚Äôs not thick like a shea butter cream and it spreads very easily. It smells exactly like oats like if you get a handful of ground oats and smell it, that‚Äôs what this smells like. It leaves a nice glow but not a greasy finish. My hair doesn‚Äôt stick to my face when I use this if that makes sense. It‚Äôs a great price point the bottle is bigger than it looks the photos. I also have pale skin and I‚Äôm always looking for milky and soothing products that will keep the redness away. This so far has been very soothing and gentle on my sensitive redness prone skin

title: PURITO Oat-in Intense Cream 150ml / 5.07 fl. oz, Vegan Ingredients, Cruelty-Free, Facial cream
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2022
content:
I saw this the day it released and Stylevana and I didn‚Äôt want to wait that long so to Amazon I went which is where I‚Äôve bought nearly all of my Purito products. It‚Äôs safe to say I own the majority of each line from purito. The moisturizers are perfection.

This one is in a 5.07 Oz pump bottle for $21!! And it goes on your face/neck this product at that price is a STEAL!
The texture comes out white and fluffy, and then once you touch it to your skin it literally melts in almost like a gel would but without the gel feeling. Definitely a cream. It has the perfect amount of slip to it which I‚Äôve come to expect from all puritos moisturizers and I love that because the feeling on your skin is like silk. It doesn‚Äôt pill. I put it over several products in my routine like my serums/essence, and it just glides on like butter!
I layered this UNDER my tretinoin since the winter dries my skin out terribly I cannot NOT use a moisturizer and a few serums first and all of puritos moisturizer aide very well in that slip that I need to put tretinoin and hydroquinone treatments on, without it they always pill. With all purito moisturizers it‚Äôs like it stops it from pulling which is my biggest pet peeve.

Ok so ingredients are perfect ü§© I wasn‚Äôt expecting such a luxury feeling to this with the ingredient deck but was pleasantly surprised. My skin has been red lately from the Midwest weather combined with mild rosacea and this definitely felt very soothing and comfortable.

I used it over Niod Modulating glucosides followed by tretinoin and then HQ. Wait about 5-10 min before applying actives like RetinA on top of moisturizers to get better absorption and less chance of pilling. I notice if I don‚Äôt wait long enough between steps most moisturizers will pull when putting rx ontop. This one doesn‚Äôt.
The packaging is FANTASTIC! Such little waste 100% recyclable didn‚Äôt come in a box it just had a cap over the pump lid thing and a piece of paper which I thoroughly appreciate! The skincare industry creates billions of pounds in waste each year and I do not like to be one that contributes to that.
I will be buying the rice silky toner now since this is such a hit!
I wore this all day as well from morning til about 11pm and I kept touching my face because it was so smooth literally 10 hours and none of the moisture when away. 5 stars and quickly moving to the top of my list as a holy grail. Zero irritation and a lot of moisturizers like cereve etc sting my skin a little bit.
Another one from purito I highly recommend is the dermide sleep mask. It‚Äôs amazing for irritated akin. A little foes a long way! I enjoy the purito dermide balm as well and the one in the blue pump bottle but I cannot think of the name.

Just buy this! It‚Äôs almost like 3 bottles of a US moisturizer in one container at 5.07 Oz when they normally come in 1.67 Oz and at $21 that‚Äôs a freaking STEAL of a deal.

Ok I‚Äôll stop fangirling over this now. If I have any updates I will update. I always do. If this helped you out at all be sure to like it!

content:
Pleasantly surprised by this serum! I didn't know what to expect from this formula but am always down to try new KBeauty products, and Purito is a classic K Beauty brand.

I came back from a week-long vacation after having fun (not eating well) and with a couple stressful travel days to my skin on the verge of breaking out all over. Mask wearing on a full day of airport and air travel, my vacation diet, and general stress had resulted in the beginnings of several breakouts. I used this serum my first night back home, and woke up to significantly less emerging bumps. Within two nights of use, there were no more spots threatening to turn into pimples or breakouts.

The serum feels very lightweight going on, sinks right into the skin. No pilling or stickiness, and it went well under my moisturizer. It has little to no scent to it, which I prefer. No stinging or irritation when I put this on, which is not always the case with acid exfoliants / skin clearing serums in my experience. Is not moisturizing by itself, but I always layer a moisturizer as a final step in my routine anyway so I'm not upset by that.

This is now my go-to if my skin is stressed / looking like breakouts are starting!

title: PURITO Clear Code Superfruit Serum 30ml/1.01 fl.oz., Next-Generation Clarifying Solution with Noni Fruit Extract, Non-Irritating, Vegan, Cruelty-Free, Suitable for Sensitive Skin, Korean Skincare
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 2, 2023
content:
One of the standout features of this serum is its use of noni fruit extract. Known for its antioxidant properties, noni fruit extract helps to protect the skin against environmental stressors, while promoting a healthy and radiant complexion. I noticed a visible improvement in the overall clarity and brightness of my skin after just a few weeks of consistent use.

What sets the PURITO Clear Code Superfruit Serum apart is its non-irritating formula. Many clarifying solutions in the market tend to be harsh and drying. However, this serum strikes the perfect balance by effectively clarifying the skin without causing any dryness or irritation. It's a relief to find a product that tackles blemishes and congestion without compromising the skin's natural moisture barrier.

Furthermore, as a conscious consumer, I appreciate PURITO's commitment to being vegan and cruelty-free. Knowing that this serum is ethically produced and free from animal-derived ingredients gives me peace of mind when using it.

The packaging of the PURITO Clear Code Superfruit Serum is sleek and functional, with a convenient pipette dispenser that ensures hygienic and mess-free application. The lightweight texture of the serum absorbs quickly into the skin, making it suitable for both morning and evening use. I found that it layers well with other products in my routine and doesn't leave any greasy or sticky residue.

title: PURITO Clear Code Superfruit Serum 30ml/1.01 fl.oz., Next-Generation Clarifying Solution with Noni Fruit Extract, Non-Irritating, Vegan, Cruelty-Free, Suitable for Sensitive Skin, Korean Skincare
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 1, 2023
content: I love Purito as a brand. 2 or 3 of their products are part of my daily routine and I am a really picky person. Their series with code superfruit is not 100% win for me. I believe it would be perfect for people with more oily skin. The product itself is of lovely colour, consistency and feels good on the skin but it leaves me a bit overproducing the sebum, ending up with a bit of a less desirable glow. It's a perfect product but not 100% for me. 4/5

title: PURITO Clear Code Superfruit Serum 30ml/1.01 fl.oz., Next-Generation Clarifying Solution with Noni Fruit Extract, Non-Irritating, Vegan, Cruelty-Free, Suitable for Sensitive Skin, Korean Skincare
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 30, 2023
content: I love a gel serum - This is the second serum by Purito that I had the pleasure of testing and it did not disappoint. It came attractively boxed and the pump bottle works well and dispenses the right amount of product. The serum feels incredibly hydrating and does not leave any tacky residue on my skin. I like the addition of Noni extract which has anti bacterial and anti fungal properties. The serum has a lovely texture and leaves my skin really smooth. Would definitely reach for again!

title: PURITO Clear Code Superfruit Serum 30ml/1.01 fl.oz., Next-Generation Clarifying Solution with Noni Fruit Extract, Non-Irritating, Vegan, Cruelty-Free, Suitable for Sensitive Skin, Korean Skincare
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 30, 2023
content:
I'm a huge fan of Purito, and their Centella Unscented Serum has been my go-to for soothing my skin and repairing its barrier. It's been a lifesaver, especially after I overdid it with essential oils. So, when I stumbled upon this Clear Code Superfruit Serum, I knew I had to give it a shot. And let me tell you, it's quickly becoming another favourite in my skincare lineup.

The first thing I noticed is how effortlessly this serum glides onto my skin. Its lightweight texture is a dream, absorbing almost instantly. But what really excites me is its clarifying power. I've dealt with redness, pesky blackheads, and the occasional acne flare-up, and this serum seems tailor-made to address all those concerns.

It's like a perfect match for my combination skin. I've been using it for a while now, and I'm already seeing improvements. My skin feels clearer, and those annoying blackheads are starting to retreat. It's exactly what I needed to keep my occasional acne in check.

In summary, this Clear Code Superfruit Serum is a winner for me. Purito has yet again impressed me with their formulation, and I'm definitely going to keep this gem in my skincare routine.

title: PURITO Clear Code Superfruit Serum 30ml/1.01 fl.oz., Next-Generation Clarifying Solution with Noni Fruit Extract, Non-Irritating, Vegan, Cruelty-Free, Suitable for Sensitive Skin, Korean Skincare
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 25, 2023
content:
This is the second PURITO product I've had the pleasure of testing out and both times, it's been a great experience. This serum is aimed at targeting excessive oil, redness and acne. Whilst I do not have acne, I do occasionally get redness and oily skin, so I thought incorporating a clarifying solution into my skincare may help these issues.

So far, in the time I've been testing it out, I have noticed one thing in particular - it breaks me out! I don't want this to put anyone off purchasing, but it's the truth - it's a clarifier, so I fully anticipated this, so I'm not shocked. It hasn't been a horrendous amount of acne, with that said - just a few pimples here and there which are going away with the help of some spot cream and hydrocolloid patches.

Keep in mind that most clarifiers work by 'purging' the skin initially, so this brings to the surface any acne or issues that were hiding out of sight. The good news is, once that stage is over, it doesn't happen again so long as you continue with the serum. (If you stop, you have to go through the purging stage all over again in the future, so it's best to just stick with it and allow the serum to do it's job, then reap the benefits along the line.)

With all that said, I am still too early in the game to notice any difference in oil or redness as my skin is still purging, but as I've had good results with another PURITO serum (one aimed at hydration), I'm hopeful for the future.

Lastly, the serum and brand is Vegan and cruelty free, so I can use it with a clear conscience! The price at the time this review was written was ¬£18.36.

Overall, this is really nice and effective serum. It is great if you have uneven skin tone and oily areas. Definitely recommend it.

title: PURITO Clear Code Superfruit Serum 30ml/1.01 fl.oz., Next-Generation Clarifying Solution with Noni Fruit Extract, Non-Irritating, Vegan, Cruelty-Free, Suitable for Sensitive Skin, Korean Skincare
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 22, 2023
content:
I have used this for three days, I did a patch test on my hand first, then a patch an hour or two later on my face and then used it all over a few hours later.

I have dry to normal cheeks and a very slightly oily t zone, although with age and a lot of swimming my skin is becoming drier.

I use facial wash to remove the chlorine at the pool and then some form of serum on my skin as an extra pick me up after the chlorine and the shower!

This regime works well for me, the rest of the time, the only other thing I apply is a night cream of some sort.

My skin is not sensitive and can tolerate most things. I had no adverse reaction to this. The consistency is a little sticky, but it does soak in with a little patience.

My skin felt very soft after using the superfoaming cleanser and the serum in tandem.

Noni fruit is a tropical fruit from Asia!

Happy to recommend, it worked well for me, but as with all facial products what suits one person may not suit another. I would always recommend you do several patch tests and go slowly with it.

title: PURITO Clear Code Superfruit Serum 30ml/1.01 fl.oz., Next-Generation Clarifying Solution with Noni Fruit Extract, Non-Irritating, Vegan, Cruelty-Free, Suitable for Sensitive Skin, Korean Skincare

Sadly for me I am unable to continue to use it. Such a shame as it looks lovely, well presented in a glass bottle with pipette. Does not particularly smell of much which is why I was surprised I reacted so badly. I will let my daughter try it and see how she gets on with it. 2* sadly for me.

title: PURITO Clear Code Superfruit Serum 30ml/1.01 fl.oz., Next-Generation Clarifying Solution with Noni Fruit Extract, Non-Irritating, Vegan, Cruelty-Free, Suitable for Sensitive Skin, Korean Skincare
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 21, 2023
content:
I'm always keen to try beauty products - like this - from Korea which, over the past decade, has taken its place as the epicentre of innovation in cosmetics and skincare. Purito's Clear Code Superfruit Serum is a next-generation, next level rebalancing serum designed to address the root causes of blemishes, clogged pores, excessively oily skin.

Vegan and cruelty-free, this 30ml serum - a fresh green in colour - arrives in an FSC-certified box printed with soy ink. It's packaged in a compactly sized frosted dropper bottle that looks stylish and makes it easy to use. The product I received has a long 19.06.2026 expiry date.

Unfragranced, it needs to be applied - just 2-3 drops - after cleanser and toner if you use it, patting to aid absorption. It applies very easily, leaving no residue or greasiness, just a feeling of intense hydration.

Where's the innovation? - This is a Superfruit Serum that contains Noni Fruit Extract and Succinic Acid. Noni fruit has been used for centuries in Polynesian cultures and appears to have wide health benefits, which include anti-inflammatory properties. Succinic acid is an established skincare ingredient with anti-oxidant properties that can help with ageing, scarring and getting rid of dead skin cells. So, all in all, it sounds like a great idea to combine the two in this excellent serum.

title: PURITO Clear Code Superfruit Serum 30ml/1.01 fl.oz., Next-Generation Clarifying Solution with Noni Fruit Extract, Non-Irritating, Vegan, Cruelty-Free, Suitable for Sensitive Skin, Korean Skincare

This is a very light, liquidy serum that absorbs quickly into the skin. It doesn't make my face sticky or oily. I don't worry about it rubbing off on my pillows because it absorbs so well. I can't say I've seen any long term effects yet, but my face feels very soft and balanced when using this. Recommended!

title: PURITO Clear Code Superfruit Cleanser 150ml / 5.07 fl. oz., Next Generation Clarifying Solution with Noni Fruit Extract,Non-Irritating,Vegan,Cruelty-Free,Suitable for Sensitive Skin,Korean Skincare
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 2, 2023
content:
One of the standout features of this cleanser is its ability to provide a thorough cleanse without causing any irritation. The formula is very gentle, making it suitable for those with sensitive skin or those prone to redness and inflammation. I found that it effectively removed dirt, excess oil, and impurities from my skin without leaving it feeling tight or stripped. Instead, my skin felt refreshed and balanced after each use.

The inclusion of Noni Fruit Extract in the formula is a notable highlight. Noni Fruit is known for its antioxidant properties, which help protect the skin against environmental stressors and free radicals. This ingredient also aids in brightening the complexion and promoting a more youthful appearance. I noticed that my skin looked more radiant and healthier after incorporating this cleanser into my skincare routine.

For those who value ethical skincare, PURITO Clear Code Superfruit Cleanser is a fantastic choice. It is vegan and cruelty-free, meaning it is not tested on animals and does not contain any animal-derived ingredients. This aligns with the growing trend of conscious consumerism and makes it a great option for individuals who prefer products that are both effective and ethically produced.

The PURITO Clear Code Superfruit Cleanser comes in a sleek and minimalistic bottle, which is not only aesthetically pleasing but also practical for everyday use. The 150ml / 5.07 fl. oz. size ensures that the product lasts for a considerable period, offering good value for money. A little goes a long way, so you don't need to use a large amount of product for each cleanse.

title: PURITO Clear Code Superfruit Cleanser 150ml / 5.07 fl. oz., Next Generation Clarifying Solution with Noni Fruit Extract,Non-Irritating,Vegan,Cruelty-Free,Suitable for Sensitive Skin,Korean Skincare

I can't smell much of anything too, which is a plus for me. 5/5 for what it is. I believe it would be a 100% win for people with combination or oily skin.

Water, Glycerin, Butylene Glycol, Dipropylene Glycol, Coco-Betaine, Lauryl hydroxysultaine, Disodium Cocoamphodiacetate, Sodium Chloride, Morinda Citrifolia Fruit Extract, Sodium Methyl Cocoyl Taurate, Saccharomyces Ferment, Cryptomeria Japonica Leaf Extract, Nelumbo Nucifera Leaf Extract, Sodium Lauroyl Methyl Isethionate, Salicylic Acid, Hydroxyacetophenone, Pentylene Glycol, Hexylene Glycol, Ethylhexylglycerin, Allantoin, Disodium EDTA, Tromethamine, Malachite Extract, Coptis Chinensis Root Extract, Gluconic Acid, Pyrus Communis (Pear) Fruit Extract, Rosa Damascena Flower Water, Prunus Persica (Peach) Fruit Extract, Hedera Helix (Ivy) Leaf/Stem Extract, Pimpinella Anisum (Anise) Fruit Extract, Vanilla Planifolia Fruit Extract, Cucumis Melo (Melon) Seed Extract, 1,2-Hexanediol, Caprylyl Glycol, Citric Acid

Designed in Korea, this cleanser has proven to be a boon for my combination skin. Its formula, catering to oily, sensitive, and combination skin types, is a rare gem in the skincare world. title: PURITO Clear Code Superfruit Cleanser 150ml / 5.07 fl. oz., Next Generation Clarifying Solution with Noni Fruit Extract,Non-Irritating,Vegan,Cruelty-Free,Suitable for Sensitive Skin,Korean Skincare
date: Reviewed in Canada on August 29, 2023
content:
It's an okay cleanser, for background on myself - I don't have acne nor acne prone skin. I'm a combination skin type. With my T-zone being where it sometimes get a little oily.

First off, the packaging is very lovely. It's quite beautiful, and the bottle pumps effortlessly.

The first time I used it, I did the recommended 2-3 pumps, I found that to be waaay too harsh for me. It left my skin very dry and flakey.

The next day I did only ONE pump instead, I found that to be a lot better. It cleansed my face without completely drying it out.

There isn't really much of a smell, but when you do get a hint of it, it's more of that acid/sterilized smell. But Heaven forbid you accidentally get a tiny bit on your lips or mouth. Jeez, it's absolutely horrendous.

All in all, it's okay. I've had others that worked better with my skin. I just find this one to be on the harsher side. But I'll keep using it and experimenting with it, I'll probably try using half a pump for my face.

title: PURITO Clear Code Superfruit Cleanser 150ml / 5.07 fl. oz., Next Generation Clarifying Solution with Noni Fruit Extract,Non-Irritating,Vegan,Cruelty-Free,Suitable for Sensitive Skin,Korean Skincare

title: PURITO Clear Code Superfruit Cleanser 150ml / 5.07 fl. oz., Next Generation Clarifying Solution with Noni Fruit Extract,Non-Irritating,Vegan,Cruelty-Free,Suitable for Sensitive Skin,Korean Skincare

title: PURITO Clear Code Superfruit Cleanser 150ml / 5.07 fl. oz., Next Generation Clarifying Solution with Noni Fruit Extract,Non-Irritating,Vegan,Cruelty-Free,Suitable for Sensitive Skin,Korean Skincare

title: PURITO Clear Code Superfruit Cleanser 150ml / 5.07 fl. oz., Next Generation Clarifying Solution with Noni Fruit Extract,Non-Irritating,Vegan,Cruelty-Free,Suitable for Sensitive Skin,Korean Skincare
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 22, 2023
content:
Play Video
I have used this foaming superfruit cleanser for 3 days. I did a couple of simple patch tests first, first on my hand, then on a small area of my face and then all over.

It is a very easy one to use, a pump or two and the foam can be easily distributed to your face, gentle spread over and rubbed in and then rinsed off. Foaming washes are so much easier to use, especially if like me you take them to the swimming pool and use them after swimming. It is great that this is non-irratating as the chlorine does dry my skin out.

I followed it up with the superfruit serum from the same supplier/manufacturer and it was equally as good.

I should say I have fairly normal skin, slightly oil t zone, the rest is normal to dry depending on the weather etc. I do not have sensitive skin or skin that is fussy, so I was expecting this to be okay and it was.

I would be happy to recommend both, but I would always advocate doing small patch tests to prevent issues particularly if you have had reactions in the past.

My skin really felt lovely when I got home, not at all dry or tight from the chlorine!

title: PURITO Clear Code Superfruit Cleanser 150ml / 5.07 fl. oz., Next Generation Clarifying Solution with Noni Fruit Extract,Non-Irritating,Vegan,Cruelty-Free,Suitable for Sensitive Skin,Korean Skincare

title: PURITO From Green Avocado Cleansing Balm 100ml / 3.38 fl. oz., Melt-In Moisture with Avocado Oil, Vegan, Cruelty-Free, Suitable for Dry Skin, Korean Skincare
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2023
content:
I am a big fan of oil-based cleansers, but they are messy and don't always work for eye makeup without causing irritation.

This one works! I've never used a balm-type cleanser before, just liquid oils. This is much less messy as there is nothing to drip. It got foundation, mascara, eye shadow, and eyebrow pencil off without any issue. It feels great to massage it in my skin and then laying a warm washcloth on top to wipe off the excess is a relaxing way to end the day. It got all of the eye makeup off, too, working much better than my usual go-to of petroleum jelly. It did not leave a greasy residue afterwards nor need excessive wiping or scrubbing to remove.

My skin felt silky smooth and soft afterwards, and not dry or tight. Usually I need to apply moisturizer shortly after cleansing because my skin just feels so tight but this was really pleasant.

It is unscented and kind of smells like vegetable oil. Not my favorite, but fortunately it does not leave any aroma behind once wiped off. Highly recommended for sensitive and dry skin!

title: PURITO From Green Avocado Cleansing Balm 100ml / 3.38 fl. oz., Melt-In Moisture with Avocado Oil, Vegan, Cruelty-Free, Suitable for Dry Skin, Korean Skincare

title: PURITO From Green Avocado Cleansing Balm 100ml / 3.38 fl. oz., Melt-In Moisture with Avocado Oil, Vegan, Cruelty-Free, Suitable for Dry Skin, Korean Skincare
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2023
content:
So couple comments

The balm is solid in the jar - much akin to coconut oil - you get it firm and then it softens - this is the same.

Love the little scoop that is included in the package. So much easier to apply - now It wont get under my nails. Boom! Bonus.

When you first apply - you will notice that there is no odor - the second thing you will notice is that it seems very oily - which immediately put me off. But dont worry about this - its very hard to describe - but it starts off oily - naturally its avocado - but then suddenly it isn't .

A little disappointed that I cannot see all the ingredients anywhere - just pictures of broccoli, avocado - what seems to be parsley/kale? and cabbage?

Regardless - it felt gorgeous on my skin - removed all my make up and did not feel oily after

I didn't know if you had to wash or wipe off - so I did a googly - work into the face for 60 seconds - rinse with warm water sever times to remove make up or dirt - then wipe with a towel

very very happy with this

title: PURITO From Green Avocado Cleansing Balm 100ml / 3.38 fl. oz., Melt-In Moisture with Avocado Oil, Vegan, Cruelty-Free, Suitable for Dry Skin, Korean Skincare

content: I love this cleansing balm they even included a scoop which is super nice since many beauty brands oftentimes sell their stuff in tubs without any scoopers which can be extremely unhygenic. It's a very nice small touch that they added to this product at it's extremely affordable price point. This cleansing balm is gentle on my face, and does an excellent job at removing bb cream after a long day. You simply scoop a decent amount into your palm and mix it in your palm and lightly lather it onto your face. Leave it on 30 seconds and your makeup will be all gone. Highly recommended for people that aren't particularly fond of cleansing oils to remove makeup since this is a great alternative.

title: PURITO From Green Avocado Cleansing Balm 100ml / 3.38 fl. oz., Melt-In Moisture with Avocado Oil, Vegan, Cruelty-Free, Suitable for Dry Skin, Korean Skincare
